characters: AT THE DRIVER'S SIDE OF THE TRUCK
IN THE CORRIDOR OF THE NEXT CAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - WIDE MOVING SHOT: Bond, dressed in a tuxedo, walks acro bridge and down some steps as if stalking someone. He loo - CLOSE SHOT: The feet of another man, wearing sweat -pan and soft shoes, walk forward. - CLOSE SHOT: Bond turns forward again, looks around and continues walking. - CLOSE SHOT: The other man's feet walk quietly up some steps. - WIDE MOVING SHOT: Bond runs down a tree-lined path towa statue, hears a bird coo and looks back. - WIDE SHOT: The other man is crossing the bridge. He is DONALD GRANT. He stops and looks in front of him. - MEDIUM SHOT: Bond, holding a revolver, moves toward som trees. - MEDIUM SHOT: Grant stops on the bridge, looking forward then cracks a branch of a tree. - BOND stops suddenly at the sound. He looks back, pauses thinking, then continues walking. - GRANT watches, then moves forward and - GRANT'S FEET walk forward but stop, pivot back and walk different direction. - MEDIUM MOVING SHOT: Bond looks back, walks forward, hea bird cooing again, looks back, then walks forward again. - WIDE ANGLE: Bond stops moving and peers behind some bus Grant crosses in f.g. holding one arm out. - BOND fires a revolver. - GRANT stops at the sound then turns and looks back.  2. - BOND, still holding the revolver, moves behind a statue continues on. - GRANT keeps looking back. - BOND walks forward glancing around anxiously. - WIDE MOVING SHOT: Grant walks toward a fountain in f.g. Bond following, then Grant passes it and moves on. - BOND emerges from behind a tree, looking in Grant's direction. - WIDE ANGLE: Bond peers behind another tree then continu forward. PAN OVER to reveal Grant waiting in f.g., concea by more trees. - CLOSE SHOT: Grant pulls a garrote from his watch. - MEDIUM MOVING SHOT: Bond turns a corner, still looking around. - FRONT ANGLE: Bond steps forward. Grant suddenly emerges from the trees behind him and whips the garrote around hi neck. Bond clutches at it helplessly as Grant strangles h and they drop to the ground. Behind them, the lights of SPECTRE House go on, revealing MEN OF THE SPECTRE PARTY, standing on a terrace. The men forward.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: rises retracting the garrote into his watch. He looks up see

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: approaching followed by the other men.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: stands at attention as Morzeny reaches him holding a watc

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: (to Grant) Exactly one minute, fifty-two seconds. That's excellent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: lies motionless on the ground. Morzeny's hand reaches dow and pulls a mask off his face, revealing an UNIDENTIFIED who has been disguised as Bond. TILT UP to reveal Morzeny Grant walking away toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAIN TITLES
dialogues.text: A BELLY DANCER performs as the credits are projected acro various parts of her body. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Long shot of the shoreline as TWO GONDOLIERS oar past in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A scoreboard reads:

dialogues.speaker: MATCH FINAL
dialogues.text: Czechoslovakia WHITE BLACK Canada

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN 1141/2 11 1/2 MACADAMS
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal KRONSTEEN ('No. 5') and MACADAMS sitt across from each other at a chess table, the 1st and 2nd UMPIRES, an ATTENDANT and SPECTATORS. Kronsteen smokes a cigarette and flicks an ash into an ashtray.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: moves his white knight and takes Macadam's black bishop, setting it beside many other black pieces.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: Check. Kronsteen clicks a timer.

dialogues.speaker: OVER KRONSTEEN'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Macadams looks thoughtfully at the board.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST UMPIRE
dialogues.text: Knight takes bishop. The Attendant moves a corresponding white piece on the scoreboard.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: Knight takes bishop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spectators look on murmuring. A WAITER approaches the table with a tray containing two glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter sets a glass in front of Macadams then turns t Kronsteen and puts a glass of water and a mat in front of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kronsteen stares at the waiter, whose hand still grips th glass. The hand backs away and Kronsteen picks up the gla and the mat. He starts to drink then looks through the gl We hear the clock still ticking.

dialogues.speaker: THE GLASS AND MAT
dialogues.text: Seen through the bottom of the glass on the mat are the w

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: sets the glass down and dabs the mat against his lips. Meanwhile Macadams looks at the chessboard. Kronsteen tea up the mat.

dialogues.speaker: OVER KRONSTEEN'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Macadams moves a black chess piece and clicks the timer.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST UMPIRE
dialogues.text: King to rook two. The Attendant moves a corresponding black piece.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: King to rook two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kronsteen picks up a white piece then glances at Macadams Macadams looks back. Kronsteen sets the piece on the tabl looks again at Macadams and clicks the timer.

dialogues.speaker: OVER KRONSTEEN'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Macadams studies the chessboard.

dialogues.speaker: THE SCOREBOARD
dialogues.text: The Attendant moves a corresponding white piece.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST UMPIRE
dialogues.text: Queen to king four.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (repeating) Queen... to king four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spectators murmur in anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: MACADAMS
dialogues.text: studies the board.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: stares back at him, eyes unmoving. Macadams' hand reaches forward and touches the top of the black king.

dialogues.speaker: OVER KRONSTEEN'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Macadams tips over his king onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: OVER KRONSTEEN'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Macadams rises.

dialogues.speaker: MACADAMS
dialogues.text: My congratulations, sir. A brilliant coup. Macadams holds out his hand as the spectators applaud. Kronsteen rises and shakes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kronsteen releases Macadams' hand and, as we CRANE DOWN, away from the table. A SPECTATOR reaches out to give hima handshake but Kronsteen ignores him and keeps walking.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: The yacht rests in a bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD with a machine gun over his shoulder comes downst Kronsteen following and looking around. The guard rings a doorbell to Blofeld's cabin. Kronsteen looks back and see SECOND ARMED GUARD coming down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSA KLEB is looking into a desktop aquarium. She moves backwards looking down at it.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Siamese fighting fish. Fascinating creatures. Brave, but on the whole, stupid.

dialogues.speaker: THE AQUARIUM
dialogues.text: Three fish swim in it.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, they're stupid.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD'S LAP
dialogues.text: A white cat rests in his lap and he pets it.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Except for the occasional one such as we have here...

dialogues.speaker: AQUARIUM
dialogues.text: The fish swim around each other and then, in quick cuts, each other.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ...who lets the other two fight while he waits... waits until the survivor is so exhausted that he cannot defend himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: watches the aquarium.

dialogues.speaker: AQUARIUM
dialogues.text: The fish continue to fight.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And then, like SPECTRE, he strikes.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: I find the parallel -- amusing.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD'S CAT
dialogues.text: Blofeld handles the cat.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Our organization did not arrange for you to come over from the Russians...

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...just for amusement, Number Three.

dialogues.speaker: CONSOLE
dialogues.text: Blofeld pushes one of four buttons on his desk

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: stands in f.g. as a door behind her opens and Kronsteen enters.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: Come in, Kronsteen. Sit down, Number Three...

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD'S CAT
dialogues.text: He continues to stroke it.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: .. while we listen to what Number Five has devised for us.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: I hope Kronsteen's efforts as Director of Planning will continue to be as successful as his chess.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: They will be. According to your instructions, I have planned for SPECTRE to steal from the Russians their new Lektor decoding machine. For this we need the services of a female member of the Russian cryptograph section in Turkey and — - uh —- the help of the British Secret Service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening, she looks up at Kronsteen.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) Naturally, neither the Russians nor the British will be aware...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues to pet it.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (continuing) ...that they are now working for us.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Number Three, is your section ready to carry out Kronsteen's directives?

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Yes, Number One. The operation will be organized according to Kronsteen's plan. I have selected a suitable girl from the Russian Consulate in Istanbul. She's capable, cooperative, and her loyalty to the State is beyond question.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: And you're absolutely sure she believes you're still...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues to stroke it.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: (continuing) ... head of operations for Soviet Intelligence?

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: It is most unlikely she would know I'm now working for SPECTRE. Moscow has kept my defection secret from everyone but a few members of the Presidium.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD'S CAT
dialogues.text: As he stroke it:

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: For your sake, I hope so.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Kronsteen, you're sure this plan is foolproof?

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: (tapping a cigarette against its case) Yes, it is, because I have anticipated every possible variation of counter -move.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD'S CAT
dialogues.text: As he strokes it:

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: But what makes you think that 'M,' the head of British intelligence, will oblige you by falling in with your plan?  10.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: For the simple reason that it is so obviously a trap. (he starts to put the cigarette into his mouth then lowers it) My reading of the British mentality is that they always treat a trap as a challenge. And in any case, they couldn't possibly pass up even the slightest chance of getting their hands on a Lektor decoder. They have wanted one for years.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD'S CAT
dialogues.text: As he strokes it:

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Um-hmm. All that you say could be true. What else?

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: As an added refinement, I think that SPECTRE would probably have the added chance of a personal revenge for the killing of our operative, Doctor No. Because the man the British will almost certainly use on a mission of this sort would be their agent, James Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BLOFELD
dialogues.text: Let his death be a particularly unpleasant and humiliating one.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: Good. I shall put my plan into operation straightaway. looks at Kronsteen.  11.

dialogues.speaker: KRONSTEEN
dialogues.text: And there will be no failure.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Naked but for shorts, he lies face-down on a towel on gra He glances up.

dialogues.speaker: A FEMALE MASSEUSE
dialogues.text: in a skirt approaches.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT AND MASSEUSE
dialogues.text: She sets a bag down then turns away and unbuttons and rem her shirt, revealing large breasts in a bra. She pulls do her skirt, revealing shorts, and turns toward Grant. She kneels, picks up a container of ointment then looks u

dialogues.speaker: A HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: hovers overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The masseuse massages Grant's back.

dialogues.speaker: THE HELICOPTER
dialogues.text: lands in front of SPECTRE House.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morzeny and other SPECTRE men, including RHODA, approach helicopter as it lands.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: Hurry. Kleb emerges from the chopper.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: (to Kleb) Welcome to SPECTRE Island. A great honour. I hope you had a pleasant flight.  12.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: My time is limited. Is the man I requested ready? Morzeny hands her a file.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: His dossier.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Good. Kleb look at the file.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Donald Grant, convicted murderer. Escaped Dartmoor Prison in nineteen sixty. Recruited in Tangier nineteen sixty-two. Excellent! Where is he now? Rhoda turns to Morzeny.

dialogues.speaker: RHODA
dialogues.text: At the Lake.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: Bring him to my office, will you? Morzeny touches Kleb's elbow as if to escort her; she bac away repulsed.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Take me to the Lake.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: (pointing) Through the training area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kleb, Morzeny and Rhoda walk across the grounds.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: This Grant's one of the best men we've ever had. Homicidal paranoiac, superb material. Though his methods were a little crude, his response to our training and indoctrination have been remarkable.  13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kleb, Morzeny and Rhoda walk along a series of galleries men fire at targets. Other men in judo garb break cinder blocks in f.g. In another gallery, a man fires a flame- thrower at a running man. Two men fight with knives. In y another gallery, men practice judo.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: I hope our work here meets with your approval?

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Training is useful, but there is no substitute for experience.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: I agree. We use live targets as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kleb, Morzeny and Rhoda walk away as the mayhem continues

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The threesome approach around a grove of trees and turn t face the Lake. Grant reclines on his back as the masseuse works on one o arms. A trampoline and barbell lay nearby. The masseuse looks up at the visitors. Kleb takes a step forward.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Call him.

dialogues.speaker: MORZENY
dialogues.text: Grant! Grant jumps to his feet and stands attention. Kleb looks him then removes her purse from her shoulder. Grant walks up to the visitors. He stops in front of Kleb stands at attention. Kleb circles him, looking him over. she does, she puts on a knuckle duster. When Kleb arrives in front of Grant again she suddenly pu him hard in the stomach. He barely flinches.  14.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: He seems fit enough. Have him report to me in Istanbul in twenty- four hours. Kleb immediately turns and walks off, Morzeny and Rhoda following.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Minarets in f.g., a mosque and the Bospherous beyond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign on an outer wall reads:

dialogues.speaker: CONSULATE GENERAL
dialogues.text: A PORTER holds open a wrought-iron gate and three embassy women emerge onto the sidewalk —- a striking blonde, TATI ROMANOVA (known as TANIA), and her friends IRINA and NATA Tania holds a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: IRINA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Are you sure you don't want to come with us?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) I have some shopping to do.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) We'll see you later as the hostel.

dialogues.speaker: IRINA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Don't be late. Goodbye for now.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Goodbye for now.

dialogues.speaker: NATASHA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Goodbye for now. Irina and Natasha walk away. Tania turns, looking at the piece of paper, and walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tania walks up a cobblestone path to a policeman and show the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (in Turkish) Can you show me this house? The policeman points further up the path.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: (in Turkish) It's the first door on the left. Tania continues up the narrowing path toward the hotel, w looks more like a sinister tenement.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH AN ARCHWAY
dialogues.text: Tania approaches the hotel, stops, looks at the paper aga looks around, then turns up a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: Tania continues up the stairs then turns down a walkway. Suddenly a man's shadow crosses a pillar in f.g. He stops behind it and watches. It's Grant, in a suit and tie. Tania stops at a door and knocks.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: MOVE IN on the door as it opens with a creak, revealing K She wears a Russian uniform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tania stands on the threshold.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Corporal of State Security Tatiana Romanova.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: (matter -of -factly) Come in. Tania enters the room. We CRANE DOWN AND IN as Kleb shuts door and follows her down a flight of stairs into an offi It contains a desk and a chair. Kleb sits behind the desk

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: You know who I am?  16.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Colonel Kleb. Head of operations for -- for SMERSH. I saw you once in Moscow when I worked for the English decoding crew.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Did you tell anyone at the Consulate you were coming here?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: No, the message said --

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Yes, yes. I know. I sent it.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA AND KLEB
dialogues.text: Tania stands watching her, uncertain. Kleb dons a pair of black-rimmed glasses and opens a doss on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Your work record is excellent. The State is proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Thank you, Comrade Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Take off your jacket. Tania is surprised, then unbuttons and removes her jacket

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Turn around. Tania obediently pivots around.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Umm. You are a fine-looking girl. Tania glances down diffidently.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: (politely) Sit down. Tania sits in the chair and keeps looking at Kleb, who continues to scan the dossier.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: I see you trained for the ballet.  17.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: But I grew an inch over regulation height, and so...

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: And then you have had three lovers? [Tania looks off shocked.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Did you enjoy their attention?]

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (showing her anger) What is the purpose of such an intimate question? Kleb explodes, cracking a short whip against her desk.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: You are not here to ask questions! You forget to whom you are speaking! [Did you enjoy it?]

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (softens then smiles) I was in love.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: And if you were not in love?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (thinks deeply, then smiles again) I suppose that would depend... on the man.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Sensible answer. Kleb rises from her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see now that Tania is sitting with her legs crossed an skirt is raised revealing her knee. Kleb walks to her holding a photograph, hands it to her t sits on the edge of the desk holding the whip.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: This man, for instance.  18.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (studying the photo) I cannot tell. Perhaps if he was kind and kulturny.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Corporal... Kleb rests a hand on Tania's knee but withdraws it at Tan look of distaste. DOLLY IN CLOSER to them.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: ...I have selected you for a most important assignment. Its purpose is to give false information to the enemy. If you complete it successfully you will be promoted. From now on you will do anything he says.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: And if I refuse?

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Then you will not leave this room alive. Tania looks at her aghast, then regains her composure.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I will obey your orders.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: She rises from the desk, then we PAN on her as she crosse behind Tania.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Good. Now these are your instructions. You report to me here.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: But the Consulate security man must not know that I am in Istanbul. This is classified far above his level.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I will say nothing to anyone. DOLLY OUT as Kleb steps toward her.  19.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: If you do, you will be shot! (she cracks the whip hard against the chair, then softens) Come, come, my dear. (she strokes Tania's shoulder ) You are very fortunate to have been chosen for such a simple, delightful duty. (her hand moves up to stroke Tania's hair) A real labour of love... as we say. DOLLY IN to Tania looking down at the photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A punt glides by with a MAN and YOUNG WOMAN inside. He is piloting.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Great sport, this!

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG WOMAN
dialogues.text: What did you say?

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: Great sport, this punting! The punt continues off. TILT DOWN TO REVEAL another punt, resting on the shoreline beneath a tree. Inside are Bond SYLVIA, embracing and kissing. An ice bucket and glasses beside it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I couldn't agree with him more.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: I might even give up golf for it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Really? He tugs on a cord that extends between his toes into the water, pulling up a bottle of champagne. He touches it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Not quite.  20. He lowers the bottle again. Sylvia notices something on h back -- a scar. She runs her finger across it.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: Ooh! Souvenir from another jealous woman? He turns back and slips an arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, but I haven't turned my back on one since. He fully embraces her and they kiss. Suddenly a BEEPER go off. Bond looks back, disheartened.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: What? He reaches into his coat pocket and switches off the devi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond climbs out of the punt with his jacket, then turns b

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Give me my shirt, will you?

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: (tossing it to him) What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I have to make a phone call. PAN ON BOND as he walks to his car —- a classic green convertible.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling) But we haven't eaten yet! I'm starving! Bond opens the driver's door and picks up a phone while raising his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (into phone) Come in, Univex. James Bond here. Over.  21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits holding her phone and with her other hand taps a cigarette against a file on her desk.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: He's been asking for you all morning. Where in the world are you, James?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He is in his shirt now, buttoning it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I've just been reviewing an old case.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: approaches in a huff. PAN ON HER as she walks to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: Oh, so I'm an old case now, am I?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Shh! It's the office. (into phone) Err... tell him I'm on my way, will you? Sylvia snatches the phone from him.

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: (into phone) He is not on his way.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (taking the phone back) Sylvia, behave! We'll do this again some other time, soon. (he keeps buttoning his shirt)

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: Do what? The last time you said that you went off to Jamaica. (she undoes one of his buttons) I haven't seen you for six months. He slaps her hand.  22.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'll be there in an hour.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: She now holds a lit cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: Hey, your old case sounds interesting, James.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND SYLVIA
dialogues.text: Sylvia has completely unbuttoned Bond's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (into phone) Er... make that an hour and a half. He returns the phone to its cradle as Sylvia quietly clap hands together. Bond passes her and raises the convertibl top. DOLLY IN till it conceals him and Sylvia and the scr goes black.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Now, about that lunch...

dialogues.speaker: SYLVIA
dialogues.text: (giggling) Hmm- hmm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door opens to reveal Bond dressed in a suit and tie a holding his hat. As he enters, PULL BACK TO REVEAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unseen by Bond, 'M' stands with Miss Moneypenny at a fili cabinet behind the door. 'M' holds a file marked 'SECRET. They look up. Bond tosses his hat at a hat-rack and it lands perfectly hook. He turns to Miss Moneypenny and begins to close the door.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: For my next miracle, I... 'M' comes into view. Bond stops cold. The others just loo at him. Chagrined, Bond gently leans against the door to it the rest of the way -- and it creaks loudly.  23. Wordlessly, 'M' nods to Bond to follow him. PAN ON THEM a they cross the room and pass through an open doorway into 'M's' office. BOOTHROYD ['Q'] stands just outside the off holding a briefcase and waiting. Bond closes a padded doo behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: (to Boothroyd) It'll be a miracle if he can explain where he's been all day. INT. 'M's OFFICE 'M' walks toward his desk, Bond following having just clo the padded inner door.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But I've never even heard of a Tatiana Romanova. tM! Ridiculous, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: It's absolutely crazy. it Of course, girls do fall in love with pictures of film stars. 'M' stops behind his desk and gestures to Bond to sit.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But not a Russian cipher clerk with a file photo of a British agent. Unless she's, uh... mental. tM! Mmm .

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No, it's some sort of trap. it (filling his pipe) Well, obviously it's a trap, and the bait is a cipher machine. A brand new Lektor.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: A Lektor, no less. The C.1.A.'s been after one of those for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: over Bond

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: takes the 24. i! 's shoulder. 'M' lights his pipe and sits. it Yes. So have we. When she contacted Kerim Bey, head of Station T, Turkey, and told him she wanted to defect, she said she'd turn it over to us, on one condition: that you went out to Istanbul and brought her and the machine back to England. (he takes a photo from the file) Here's a snapshot Kerim managed to get of her. photo, glances at it absently, then looks up.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know too much about cryptography, sir, but, uh... a Lektor could decode their top secret signals. The whole thing's so fantastic, it just could be... (he finally looks at the photo and catches himself) ...true.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTO
dialogues.text: shows Tania standing at a railing aboard a ship with one raised provocatively, holding her hair back.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: continues

dialogues.speaker: '', (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hmm. That had occurred to me. to look at the photograph

dialogues.speaker: '', (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Besides, the Russians haven't been up to any tricks recently.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, really, I'm not too busy at the moment, sir.  25.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND 'M'
dialogues.text: it You're booked on the eight-thirty plane in the morning. If there's any chance of us getting a Lektor, we simply must look into it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Suppose when she meets me in the flesh, I don't come up to expectations?

dialogues.speaker: 'M'
dialogues.text: over Bond's shoulder. tM! Just see that you do. He presses a switch on his intercom. it Miss Moneypenny, ask the Equipment Officer to come in, please. (he releases the switch) Q Branch has put together a smart looking piece of luggage for us.

dialogues.speaker: THE PADDED DOOR
dialogues.text: Boothroyd enters carrying the briefcase. PAN ON HIM as he walks to the desk, to include Bond and 'M'.
We're issuing this to all double-o personnel. Boothroyd nods to Bond and sets the briefcase on the desk Bond rises to face him.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: An ordinary black leather case... (tilts it up and points to two buttons on its back edge) . with twenty rounds of ammunition here and here. Boothroyd presses one of the buttons and a narrow tube po up. Bond does the same to the other button and another tu pops up.  26.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: (indicating the tube) Now, if you take the top off, you'll find the ammunition inside. Bond opens the top and drops a couple of bullets into his hand, then returns them to the tube. Meanwhile Boothroyd turns the briefcase the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: In the side here: flat throwing knife.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIEFCASE
dialogues.text: Boothroyd's hand enters.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Press that button there... (he presses a release and a knife pops out) . out she comes. Bond's hand enters and takes the knife.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Boothroyd opens the briefcase and sets it down flat.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Inside the case...

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIEFCASE
dialogues.text: The inside is bright red and contains what looks like par a rifle. Boothroyd's hand picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ... you'll find an AR Seven folding sniper's rifle. (he pulls the heel off the grip, revealing a barrel hidden inside) Point-two-five calibre, with an infra-red telescopic sight. He reattaches the heel and sets the rifle beside the briefcase. Then he pulls on a strap connecting the case's to its body. A hidden strap comes out of the inner lining gold sovereigns are embedded in it.  27.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Then, if you pull out these straps, inside are fifty gold sovereigns. Twenty-five in either side. He slides the strap back into the lining.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Now watch very carefully. (he reaches down)

dialogues.speaker: THEIR TORSOS
dialogues.text: Boothroyd takes a tin of talcum powder from his pocket. I bears the trademark 'Club.'

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: An ordinary tin of talcum powder. Inside, a tear gas cartridge.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: That goes in the case against the side...

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIEFCASE
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN as Boothroyd's hand attaches the tin to the insi the case.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: here, like that. It's magnetized so it won't fall. His hands shut the case and close the catches.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Shut the case.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Now, normally to open a case like that...

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIEFCASE, (BOND'S POV)
dialogues.text: Boothroyd's thumbs rest on the catches.  28.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: ... you move the catches to the side. (his thumbs move sideways without touching the catches) If you do, the cartridge will explode -- in your face.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Now, to stop the cartridge exploding...

dialogues.speaker: THE BRIEFCASE, (BOND'S POV)
dialogues.text: Boothroyd's fingers twist the catches sideways.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: turn the catches horizontally, like that. Then open normally. His thumbs open the catches and the briefcase pops open.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Now you try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pipe in his mouth, 'M' looks up at Bond, removes the pipe blows out smoke.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIUM TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: Bond moves behind the upright case and lays his fingers t catches.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Hmm. Turn the catches... (twisting them) ...like that...

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And open ordinarily. Bond snaps the briefcase open then grins in satisfaction.  29.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: You've got it?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, I think so.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: (to 'M', off) Is that all, sir?

dialogues.speaker: '', (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes, thanks very much.

dialogues.speaker: BOOTHROYD
dialogues.text: Right. Thank you. Boothroyd exits as Bond closes the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That's a nasty little Christmas present. But I shouldn't think I'll need it on this assignment, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: it All the same, take it with you. WIDE ANGLE OVER 'M's SHOULDER it Good luck, Double-o-seven.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. Bond heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He returns the pipe to his mouth and looks down at the fi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond enters from 'M's office flipping the padded door shu behind him. PAN WITH HIM as he walks to Miss Moneypenny's desk and sets the briefcase down.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: ‘Once more into the breach, dear friends.' Miss Moneypenny holds up an airline ticket.  30.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: And one plane ticket. Bond sits on the edge of her desk and takes the ticket fr her. SLOW DOLLY IN to tight two-shot as they talk.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: Lucky man. I've never been to Istanbul.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You've never been to Istanbul?

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (leaning toward her) Where the moonlight on the Bospherous is irresistible.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: (rising and touching her forehead to his) Maybe I should get you to take me there some day. I've tried everything else.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Darling Moneypenny, you know I never even look at another woman.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: Oh, really, James?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh-huh. Let me tell you the secret of the world... (he leans back to her ear) Just then her intercom buzzes.

dialogues.speaker: INTERCOM
dialogues.text: Miss Moneypenny's finger switches it on. PULL BACK TO MED TWO-SHOT of Bond and Miss Moneypenny. 'M' (over intercom) Miss Moneypenny, ask Double O Seven to leave the photograph. I'm sure he'll recognize the lady when he sees her.  31. Miss Moneypenny holds out her hand. Bond takes out Tania' photograph and sets it on her palm. Then he picks up a pe

dialogues.speaker: THE PHOTOGRAPH
dialogues.text: Bond's hand writes the words 'WITH LOVE,' then adds above

dialogues.speaker: MEDIUM TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: Bond picks up the briefcase and steps off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: (watching him go) Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (passing in front of her) Ciao!

dialogues.speaker: MISS MONEYPENNY
dialogues.text: Ciao!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plane lands on a runway marked '2.' PAN ON IT as the no wheel touches down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A number of AIRPORT OFFICIALS look out the windows.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: (into microphone) Hello, London. Your flight P-A-One just landed Istanbul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, wearing a grey suit and holding his briefcase, walk through the lounge, surrounded by other passengers. He passes a CHAUFFEUR who stands holding a glass at a dri tray manned by a DRINK SELLER. The chauffeur sports a mustache and wears a grey suit, black tie, cap and gloves

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: (seeing him) Mr. Bond! (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAUFFEUR (cont'd) (to the drink seller, in Turkish) Tesekkir ederim. Bond stops and looks back. The chauffeur

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: Kerim Bey sent a car for you,

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, fine. (reaches into his coat and takes out a cigarette case) Can I borrow a match?

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: I use a lighter.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (opening the case to reveal cigarettes) It's better still.

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: Until they go wrong.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (shutting the case) Exactly. Bond gestures to the chauffeur to move on.

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: I'll get the car, sir. The chauffeur walks off. Bond follows in SHOT, returning the cigarette case to his off and we HOLD on a man in b.g. watching Hassan steps forward, staring after him.

dialogues.speaker: SAME
dialogues.text: walks to him. sir.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE TRUCKING
dialogues.text: pocket. Bond walks him —- HASSAN.

dialogues.speaker: TIME
dialogues.text: Bond follows the chauffeur to a black Rolls Royce waiting the curb. raises a gloved hand to his mouth. one of the gloved fingers.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S ROLLS ROYCE
dialogues.text: PAN ON IT as it drives away, then HOLD on terminal. Hassan emerges watching it go. pulls up. Meanwhile we see GRANT'S FACE reflected in the driver's door mirror of a car in f.g., watching them. PAN TO GRANT. He He chews on the front of the A black Citreon car Hassan climbs into the passenger seat.  33.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: sits in his car watching.

dialogues.speaker: THE CITREON
dialogues.text: PAN ON IT as it drives off. [Mistake: the passenger seat vacant! ]

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO TERMINAL
dialogues.text: The Citreon drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chauffeur is in f.g., Bond behind him in the back sea Bond waves his hat across his face against the heat. Thro the rear window we see the Citreon following.

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: Kerim Bey suggested that you see him before going to the hotel, sir. Would that be convenient?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Fine. Bond glances back, sees the Citreon following, then looks forward again and continues fanning his face with his hat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON THE ROLLS as it drives on. Then HOLD on ancient ru in b.g. as the Citreon passes following it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rolls continues past some buildings and continues dow open road. The Citreon keeps following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the Citreon still visible through the rear window.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I suppose it's customary to have people trailing you in these parts.

dialogues.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, sir. Today it's Citreon H-three-one-eighty-four on duty. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAUFFEUR (cont'd) They are Bulgarians working for the Russians. They follow us, we follow them. It's a sort of understanding we have.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That's very friendly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRANE BACK ON THE ROLLS as it swings over toward the Gran Bazaar and stops.

dialogues.speaker: THE CITREON
dialogues.text: stops just short of the Rolls. Hassan jumps out and looks off.

dialogues.speaker: A COBBLESTONE STREET
dialogues.text: Bond and the chauffeur walk down the street. PAN ON them they walk into the bazaar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON THEM as the chauffeur leads Bond through the Bazaa It is filled with people and Bond glances back at some of them. They continue past us and walk off.

dialogues.speaker: HASSAN
dialogues.text: stands in a passageway drinking a cup of coffee and watch them.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND THE CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: They turn into a shop where Turkish rugs hang outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chauffeur leads Bond through the shop to a door cover a hanging tapestry. Salesmen are showing rugs to customer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chauffer pulls a cord which retracts the tapestry, revealing a door. He opens the door to reveal an office. Bond starts to step inside but stops, seeing KERIM'S MIST within. She is picking up a hat, dons it and walks toward doorway straightening the shoulder of her blouse. DOLLY B as she exits past Bond pulling her skirt down and straightening her hat.  35. Bond steps into the office followed by the chauffeur.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ah, my friend, come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON BOND as he walks in, the chauffeur following. The office is well-appointed with curtains, pillars, and a la bed with a golden cover that KERIM BEY is straightening. turns to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Come in! Glad to see you! Welcome to Istanbul! Kerim walks to Bond and shakes his hand, then PAN ON THEM they walk to Kerim's desk.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you for sending the car, but, uh —- it does rather tie you in with me. Bond sits in a chair across from the desk. Kerim picks up yellow plastic cigarette holder and a wooden cigarette bo

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: You are in the Balkans now, Mr. Bond. The game with the Russians is played a little differently here. In the day-to-day routine matters we don't make it too difficult to keep a tab on each other. Kerim holds out the box to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (taking a cigarette from the box) So I gathered from your chauffeur. He's a rather intelligent young man, by the way. Bond lights the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: steps back behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: He should be. He's my son.  36. Kerim picks up a bell and rings it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He puffs on the cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Coffee?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Medium sweet. A YOUNG MAN enters through the doorway behind him.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Two, medium sweet. ANGLE ON BOND, KERIM IN F.G. The young man nods and shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: He also is my son.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND KERIM
dialogues.text: Kerim sits at his desk, his cigarette burning in the yell holder.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: All of my key employees are my sons. Blood is the best security in this business.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You must have quite an establishment here.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Biggest family payroll in Turkey. Not bad for a man who started life breaking chains and bending bars with his teeth in a circus. But let's talk about this business of yours.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, 'M' thinks I'm wasting my time here.  37.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: And so do I. (points to his nose) This is an old friend of mine. And it tells me something smells.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Maybe. But if there's a chance of getting a Lektor... Now you tell me. Where can I contact this girl?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: She said she would make her own arrangements. You'll just have to wait. A knock sounds at the door.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (rising) Ah!

dialogues.speaker: A YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: walks in carrying a tray containing two demitasse cups. P ON HIM as he walks to Kerim's desk and sets the tray down

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Thank you. The young man exits. Kerim sets his cigarette in an ashtr hands Bond a cup and takes the other cup.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: My friend, if you really want my advice... DOLLY IN on Kerim.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: . you should spend a few pleasant days with us here in Istanbul, then... then go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rolls Royce drives through an archway and down a stre [Mistake: there are no passengers.] The Citreon immediate follows.  38.

dialogues.speaker: HASSAN
dialogues.text: emerges from the Bazaar looking at both cars.

dialogues.speaker: BOTH CARS
dialogues.text: drive off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant is driving and, in f.g., is a pair of tied-up hands Cut to:

dialogues.speaker: THE DRIVER
dialogues.text: lies bound and gagged in the back seat bleeding from a ga his temple. TILT UP to Grant who glances back then continues to drive

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN on Bond as he enters carrying his briefcase; the chauffeur follows carrying Bond's suitcase. They stop at front desk. A MALE CONCIERGE turns to Bond; there is a FEMALE RECEPTI behind him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: James Bond. You have a reservation for me.

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: Ah, Mister Bond. Your room is ready. (to the receptionist) Number thirty-two. The concierge rings a bell. A PORTER walks up and takes t suitcase from the chauffeur.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE ASSISTANT
dialogues.text: (to the porter) Thirty-two for Mister Bond.

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: (to Bond) Hope you enjoy your stay.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you.  39. The chauffeur tips his hat to Bond, then Bond and the por cross the lobby and enter a lift. The doors close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The porter opens the door for Bond. Bond enters, crosses room and drops his briefcase on the bed. He hears the por clear his throat and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Will there be anything else, sir? Bond slips some cash into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No, only this. Thank you. Bond turns to the bathroom door. The porter peeks at the money.

dialogues.speaker: PORTER
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir. The porter exits. Bond opens the bathroom door and looks inside, then turns painting on the wall and looks behind it, then walks to another painting and looks behind it. Then he crosses the room, glances at a clock, then looks behind another paint On the wall behind it are a microphone and a cord.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: backs away, continuing to look around. He sees a chandeli overhead, walks under it and turns it around, then steps forward and looks at:

dialogues.speaker: A PHONE
dialogues.text: resting on the nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: turns up his briefcase, moves the catches sideways and op it. He takes out a test instrument and picks up the phone

dialogues.speaker: PHONE
dialogues.text: Bond places the instrument beneath it. The meter rises an crackles.  40.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: drops the phone onto the bed and picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Mister Bond here.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'm afraid the room won't do.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST'S VOICE
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: The bed's too small.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (into phone) One moment, sir. She turns to the concierge, who stands in a back room hol a receiver. A WOMAN sits behind him at a console wearing headphones.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (to the concierge) Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: Tell him that's all there is, unless he would like the Bridal Suite. The concierge raises the receiver to his ear.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'm sorry, sir. That's all we have available, except the Bridal Suite.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (into phone) Well, let's have a look at it. I may like it.  41.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DESK
dialogues.text: The receptionist cups her hand over the receiver and look back at the concierge. He nods to her.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (into phone) The porter will show it to you. He will be up immediately. She rings the bell. The concierge walks up to her.

dialogues.speaker: CONCIERGE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He cups his hand over the mouthpiece, hears a click, grin tightly and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A whistle sounds as the Citreon drives up and stops at th curb. Grant emerges. PAN ON HIM as he walks off removing gloves, then HOLD on the doorman.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: gets into a green car which drives away.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORMAN
dialogues.text: walks to the Citreon, suddenly sees something and pulls t back door open.

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAD DRIVER'S HEAD
dialogues.text: which was leaning against the door falls forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant sits in back with Kleb.

dialogues.speaker: KLEB
dialogues.text: Good work. (puts on her glasses and looks at a dossier) Who can the Russians suspect but the British? The Cold War in Istanbul will not remain cold very much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: with the Bospherous in b.g. We hear a wailing prayer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim's mistress lies on a bed tonguing a string of black pearls.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S MISTRESS
dialogues.text: Ali Kerim Bey? She looks off then glances at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim sits in a chair writing in a file. The mistress tur over and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S MISTRESS
dialogues.text: Ali Kerim Bey!

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (glancing back) Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: THE MISTRESS
dialogues.text: drops the string of pearls from her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S MISTRESS
dialogues.text: Ali Kerim Bey.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: He sits unmoved, continuing to write.

dialogues.speaker: THE MISTRESS
dialogues.text: gets up, straightens her skirt, walks over to Kerim and p her hands around him.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S MISTRESS
dialogues.text: You're not glad to see me this morning, sirree?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (annoyed) Over joyed.  43.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S MISTRESS
dialogues.text: I... I no longer please you?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Be still. Giving up, he slaps the file down on his lap then sets it table.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (rising) Back to the salt mines.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: walks toward the bed unbuttoning his jacket. From behind, mistress removes it. [MISTAKE: She starts further away. ] Kerim turns. She wraps her arms around him and they kiss. Suddenly an explosion occurs which bathes them both in re She screams and they fall.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S DESK
dialogues.text: one leg broken crashes to the floor as smoke envelops it the image turns black.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S STORE
dialogues.text: PAN ON BOND as he walks through the store then through th open doorway into Kerim's office. Workmen are clearing th debris.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Careful with those papers! DOLLY IN as Bond approaches Kerim who dusts a table-top w his handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, who won?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I had visitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON KERIM as he moves the table to one side and sets i down.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Limpet mine on the wall outside, timed to catch me at my desk. But by good fortune, I was relaxing on the settee for a few moments. The girl left in hysterics.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (grinning) Found your technique too violent?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I cannot understand this sudden breach of the truce. It is unlike our Russian friends to break the peace this way.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: It's most inconsiderate. I think my visit might have something to do with it.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Let's try and find out. Kerim walks off; Bond follows.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM'S SHOWROOM
dialogues.text: DOLLY BACK as Kerim leads Bond into the showroom, grabs a flashlight from the wall and goes to a door covered by a tapestry. Kerim pulls a cord, withdrawing the tapestry to reveal a door which he opens.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (to an assistant) Close up after us. Bond goes through the doorway, Kerim follows and shuts th door. An ASSISTANT walks up and retracts the tapestry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim walk down a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Quite a place you've got here.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: The Emperor Constantine built it as a reservoir sixteen hundred years ago.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Really?  45.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (tossing him the flashlight) Here. Kerim unties a boat, they get in (Bond sitting and Kerim standing), and Kerim moves them away with an oar.

dialogues.speaker: THE OAR
dialogues.text: Rats climb across it. Kerim tilts it to drop them back in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim continues rowing them through the cistern.

dialogues.speaker: THE BOAT
dialogues.text: passes more pillars.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: My daily exercise. At eleven in the morning; at three in the afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: THE OAR
dialogues.text: continues guiding them.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tie her up, will you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond gets out and ties the boat to a dock, then Kerim get out.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Mind your head now. They walk across a cobblestone path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass through an archway into another part of the cis

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Underneath the Russian Consulate. He pulls a tarpaulin off a periscope.  46.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: A present from your navy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim raises the periscope and wipes the lens with his handkerchief.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Our friends were turned out while the Public Works Ministry conducted a survey. The story was that the heavy traffic was shaking the foundations. By the time the place was declared safe, I had this installed.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I can see everything 'M' said about you is right.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Or, why I stay in this mad business?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, it could be that you find selling rugs a bore.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: My friend, you should be a mind reader. Kerim looks into the periscope.

dialogues.speaker: A CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: GENERAL VASSILI, KOSLOVSKI, BENZ and another MAN sit at a conference table.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Head of the table is General Vassili, Director of Military Intelligence. On his left, Koslovski, Chief of Security. Opposite him, Benz, one of his agents. He pans the periscope to one side.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I can't see the face of the other man —- the one the general is shouting at.  47.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND KERIM
dialogues.text: Kerim steps back and Bond looks through the periscope.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He's giving him a hell of a blowing up for something.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: Bond pans across the room.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It's too bad we can't hear as well as see.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Tell me, does our girl Romanova ever come to this room?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Sometimes with messages.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: Koslovski leans back in his chair, revealing the other ma

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I can see the face of the other man now.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND KERIM
dialogues.text: Bond steps back and Kerim looks through the periscope aga

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (exclaiming) Krilencu!

dialogues.speaker: THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: KRILENCU, an evil-looking man with a mustache, is speakin vociferously.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: So he's back! Another Bulgarian they use as a killer.  48.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND KERIM
dialogues.text: Looking up at them from a LOWER ANGLE

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Just the man for that limpet mine job. I have had trouble with him before. But he's stayed away from Istanbul for over a year now. Take a look —- you should remember him. This man kills for pleasure. Bond looks through the periscope.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: Krilencu is still talking, then suddenly stops and looks the door which is opening.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nice face. —- Just a moment... A smart-looking pair of female legs enter —- Tania.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A girl's just come in.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Probably Romanova. She's the only one who's allowed to. How does she look to you?

dialogues.speaker: THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: The periscope pivots, following Tania's legs.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Well, from this angle, things are shaping up nicely. I'd like to see her in the flesh. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND KERIM
dialogues.text: Bond backs away from the periscope.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Could you get me a plan of that place?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I wish I could.  49.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But there must be the original architect's drawings registered somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I'll get onto that. (lowers the periscope) Now, I need a little time to deal with this stinking Krilencu. It will be better if you didn't stay at the hotel tonight. Come. PAN ON THEM as Kerim walks off, Bond following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A station wagon approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim sit in back. Kerim fans his face with his Bond glances back then forward again.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I see now why you keep the Rolls.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: One of my sons is driving it, with two dummies in the back... in the opposite direction. They'll follow it for hours. You'll like my Gypsy friends. I use them like the Russians use the Bulgars. I'm afraid it's created a blood feud between them.

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION WAGON
dialogues.text: It continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO BULGARS in dark clothes lurk in f.g. behind an archwa one of them holding a walkie-talkie. DOLLY IN THROUGH THE ARCHWAY as the station wagon drives and stops in front of a house. TWO SENTRIES approach it.  50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim [actually a stand-in] get out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST SENTRY
dialogues.text: (in Romany) Ah, Kerim Bey! They walk toward the house.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE ARCHWAY
dialogues.text: The Bulgar with the walkie-talkie pulls out an antenna.

dialogues.speaker: 1ST BULGAR
dialogues.text: (into walkie-talkie) Hello, Krilencu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krilencu listens on a walkie-talkie, surrounded by OTHER BULGARS. He glances at his watch, speaks into the walkie- talkie in Bulgarian, then rises with the others and gets a lorry which drives off.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim approach. A GYPSY MAN comes running forwar and converses with Kerim in Romany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gypsy man finishes talking and runs off.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: It seems we have come on the wrong night. Two girls in love with the same man have threatened to kill each other. It must be settled in the Gypsy way. As I am an old friend of the family, I think we'll be allowed to stay. A GYPSY GIRL steps toward them speaking in Romany and gesturing forward.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: We are bidden to table. I hope you're good at eating with your fingers.  51.

dialogues.speaker: VAVRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (shouting) Kerim Bey!

dialogues.speaker: GYPSY CAMP
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim follow the Gypsy girl across the encampmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON ANOTHER GYPSY GIRL carrying a liquor bottle and pu out the cork with her teeth. She stops at the head table where Bond and Kerim are sitting with Vavra, the Gypsy chieftain.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Ah, Rachi. Filthy stuff. The Gypsy girl fills his glass while A THIRD GYPSY GIRL w up to Bond carrying a cushion. He rises, she sets it on h seat, and he sits again, thanking her in Romany.

dialogues.speaker: A FEMALE GYPSY DANCER
dialogues.text: rises into frame raising her arms seductively behind her and starts to dance.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - Bond and Kerim look back at her. - She moves past their table dancing erotically and passe MUSICIANS who are playing. - Bond, Kerim and Vavra watch her (Kerim grinning broadly - She continues to dance; TILT DOWN on her swaying hips. - Kerim holding the Rachi bottle refills his glass. - The dancer's hips continue to sway. - Kerim sips from his glass. - Now she moves her belly in and out seductively. - Bond, Kerim and Vavra continue to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: raises her arms above her head and swings her body erotic  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - A SENTRY stands on the gate watching the encampment. - Krilencu's head rises over a wall looking at him. - The sentry continues watching, then glances back. - Krilencu throws a knife at him. - The knife pierces the sentry's heart and he falls dead. - Krilencu gestures to OTHER BULGARS.

dialogues.speaker: KRILENCU
dialogues.text: Quick!

dialogues.speaker: THE ARCHWAY
dialogues.text: Krilencu beckons and the lorry drives through the archway stops for a moment for Krilencu to get into the passenger then continues on. PAN ON IT to reveal Grant in f.g., hol a pistol and watching.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - The Gypsy dancer continues to sway seductively, then dr to her knees swaying. - Bond, Kerim and Vavra continue to watch. - The dancer rises and wiggles her ass frantically, revol around then moves forward. - She approaches Bond who looks on appreciatively. - She smiles at him as she dances. - Bond watches intently as she wiggles her ass in front o - Kerim, looking on, grins. - The dancer leans backwards so that her breasts are almo Bond's face. Her mouth comes close to his and they almost kiss, then she runs off and the music stops.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Tell our host his hospitality overwhelms me.

dialogues.speaker: THREE-SHOT
dialogues.text: Kerim turns to Vavra and speaks in Romany.  53.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: Bond grins at Kerim as Kerim grins off at Vavra.

dialogues.speaker: VAVRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you! Bond and Kerim laugh.

dialogues.speaker: ZORA'S CARAVAN
dialogues.text: TwO GYPSY MEN approach. The first one opens the door. ZOR wearing a scarf and green top, immediately comes out. PAN WITH HIM as he walks to VIDA's caravan, pulls back a tarp beckons and tells her in Romany to come out. She emerges, wearing a red top, and walks down some steps. Zora glares at her then lunges at her and they embrace in battle.

dialogues.speaker: THREE-SHOT
dialogues.text: Vavra calls out in Romany. The first man separates the two girls. Kerim turns to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: No matter what happens now, say and do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two girls approach as Vavra talks to them in Romany.

dialogues.speaker: THREE-SHOT
dialogues.text: As Vavra continues speaking in Romany, DOLLY IN on Bond a Kerim.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (to Bond) He's asking them whether they'll cease their blood feud and give up this fight. The elders of the tribe will then decide who, in the end, will marry the chief's son. Vida's voice sounds from 0.S. in Romany, replying to Vavr

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: Vida is speaking angrily.  54.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: She's saying that...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, I think I got it without the sub-titles. Kerim laughs. THE TwO GIRLS start to fight.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - A Gypsy man separates them. - The girls run forward. - Kerim watches intently. - Zora pulls off her scarf and ties it around her waist. - Vida, watching her angrily, ties her own scarf around h waist. - The two girls face each other. - Bond, Kerim and Vavra look on. - Vida holds her hands up like finger-nailed weapons. - Zora lunges forward but passes her. - Vida turns toward her, again holding up her nailed fing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, Kerim and Vavra watch in b.g. as the two girls face in f.g. The girls grab each other and pivot round and rou Vavra watches intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clutch each other. Vida holds back Zora's hand which trie gouge her face. TILT DOWN to their feet as they circle ea other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zora trips Vida. She falls to the ground and rolls across  55. As the men watch in b.g., Zora jumps at Vida but misses a lands face-down. Vida jumps onto Zora's back and starts t strangle her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: watches intently.

dialogues.speaker: THE GIRLS
dialogues.text: roll around on the ground, clutching each other's throats the men keep watching in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Each tries to strangle the other, Zora atop Vida. - Zora keeps strangling. - Vida, looking up, strangles back. - Vida kicks Zora backwards. - Zora lands on her ass. - Both on their knees now, the girls face off. - Zora glares at Vida. - The girls rise and clutch each other again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls fall against a table, men scattering to make ro for them. Vida picks up a bottle, ready to smash Zora's f with it. Suddenly a GUNSHOT sounds. The girls freeze and look up. ZIP TILT UP AND ZOOM IN on a sentry on a wall falling dead in a puff of smoke.

dialogues.speaker: THE HEAD TABLE
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN on Bond, Kerim and Vavra jumping up. Bond grabs gun from inside his coat.

dialogues.speaker: THE ARCHWAY
dialogues.text: The Bulgar's truck drives in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Krilencu rides in the passenger seat. Kerim fires a revolver at him.  56. Krilencu, outside the truck now, runs forward holding a revolver and fires it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Gypsy falls dead as A DOZEN BULGARS run in through the archway firing guns.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: A Gypsy runs past him then Bond rises, aims his revolver fires.

dialogues.speaker: KRILENCU
dialogues.text: hears the gunshot and dashes off.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: still sitting at the head table tries to fire his revolve it is jammed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Kerim [actually a stand-in] shoots an oncoming Bu who drops to the ground. ANOTHER BULGAR runs toward Kerim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bulgar jumps onto the table. Kerim upturns it, flingi the Bulgar to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim [actually a stand-in] fires his gun over the overtu table.

dialogues.speaker: AT A CARAVAN
dialogues.text: A Bulgar with a flaming torch sets the caravan ablaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond dashes past in f.g. A Gypsy shoots the Bulgar with t torch. From 0.S., a dagger flies at Bond. It misses him, lodging in a tent-pole. A fighting Gypsy and Bulgar fall the tent. Bond grabs the dagger and cuts down the tent on them.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: on his knees fires his revolver again.  57.

dialogues.speaker: KRILENCU
dialogues.text: holding his own revolver takes a step back and fires it.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: is wounded in the arm; he grabs the bullet-hole as blood gushes out.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: aims his revolver off at Krilencu.

dialogues.speaker: KRILENCU
dialogues.text: darts away between two caravans.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: runs forward, chasing him.

dialogues.speaker: A CARAVAN
dialogues.text: blazes in flame.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: looks at his bloody arm. A GYPSY runs behind him firing a revolver. Kerim picks up his revolver with his other hand fires it. A BULGAR drops dead from the bullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GYPSY fights off a BULGAR with a knife in f.g. as a hor runs away in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A caravan blazes behind them. Bond enters.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: hits the Bulgar in the neck with a judo-chop and he falls

dialogues.speaker: THE GYPSY AND BULGAR
dialogues.text: roll across the ground clutching each other. AS a caravan blazes behind them, a GYPSY throws a BULGAR a corral fence.  58.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BLAZING CARAVAN
dialogues.text: Bond slices a holding rope with the dagger.

dialogues.speaker: THE CARAVAN
dialogues.text: rolls forward, crashing into the fighting Gypsy and Bulga against the corral fence.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND
dialogues.text: Bond sees Krilencu. He takes a step back and aims the dag

dialogues.speaker: KRILENCU
dialogues.text: steps sideways and fires his revolver.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: throws the dagger at him.

dialogues.speaker: KRILENCU
dialogues.text: runs behind a caravan, avoiding it.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: runs forward then stops beside a caravan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond trips a BULGAR running by. The Bulgar falls to the ground. Bond leans down, smashes the Bulgar's head with t butt of his pistol, then runs off.

dialogues.speaker: A HIGH ARCHWAY
dialogues.text: Grant, holding a revolver, steps through the archway onto high ledge and crouches, watching the fracas.

dialogues.speaker: OVER GRANT'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Men fight below as horses run past.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER LEDGE
dialogues.text: A BULGAR on the ledge fires a pistol. A GYPSY jumps him f behind. They struggle. A horse crosses in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: runs forward, aims his revolver and shoots an ONCOMING BU in the stomach. TILT DOWN as the Bulgar falls and Bond ru off.  59.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE LEDGE
dialogues.text: The fighting men roll off the ledge to the ground as men in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: gripping his gun runs toward a small lake; beyond it is a wall and ledge. We glimpse Vavra and a BULGAR running at other at the base of the wall. Bond sees a Bulgar behind him and shoots him. A white hor runs past. On the ground, beneath the white horse, Gypsies and Bulga are fighting. Bond turns. He sees Vavra and the Bulgar fighting at the of the wall. Above them, a BULGAR aims a rifle downwards the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Head down! Vavra drops to the ground. Bond drops to one knee aiming the Bulgar on the ledge. Bond fires. The Bulgar falls. Vavra rises waiving to Bond

dialogues.speaker: VAVRA
dialogues.text: Thank you! Thank you! Vavra runs off. Bond runs forward firing his revolver aga Then Bond pivots and upturns a table on which a Bulgar an Gypsy are fighting. The men land in the lake.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: He continues to watch as men fight below and horses run p Below him, a BULGAR stands on a straw roof, also watching

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Bond stops and shoots a BULGAR running by; the Bulgar fal over an overturned table.

dialogues.speaker: THE STRAW ROOF
dialogues.text: The Bulgar, gripping a knife, jumps off the roof. He land just behind Bond. The Bulgar raises the knife to stab Bond in the back.  60.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: watching through the archway, fires his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND THE BULGAR
dialogues.text: The Bulgar drops to the ground. Bond turns and notices hi for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Grant fires again at the Bulgar as Bond looks at the body The body whirls around from the force of the shot.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks around in confusion, then looks off and fires his g

dialogues.speaker: THE GATEWAY
dialogues.text: Bulgars begin running out toward the truck. Krilencu foll then stops and shouts back in Bulgarian to retreat. More Bulgars run toward the gateway, shooting behind them they run. Krilencu fires his gun at someone then keeps gesturing an shouting as still more Bulgars run past. Krilencu runs ou after them.

dialogues.speaker: THE GYPSY CAMP
dialogues.text: The battle ends as Gypsies surround the remaining Bulgars others retreat in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON BOND returning his revolver to its holster as he w He reaches a tent where Kerim holds a bottle of Rachi.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Did you get Krilencu?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No. Bond takes the bottle and pours alcohol on Kerim's wound. GYPSY GIRL walks by.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to the girl) Just a minute. Here. (he takes her scarf) Thank you.  61. The girl walks off. Bond presses Kerim's handkerchief aga his would.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: You fought well. I am nothing but a clumsy old man. A SCREAM sounds from 0O.s.

dialogues.speaker: THE GYPSY CAMP
dialogues.text: Vavra and some torch-bearing Gypsies surround a Bulgar on ground.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They are making one of the wounded Bulgars talk. Vavra looks back.

dialogues.speaker: VAVRA
dialogues.text: Kerim Bey! Vavra continues speaking in Romany.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND KERIM
dialogues.text: The scarf has been tied like a sling over Kerim's arm and shoulder. Kerim holds the Rachi bottle.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: It was me they were after. Why would they want me out of the way? Bond steps behind him and adjusts the sling.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Tomorrow we will have to find Krilencu's hide-out. Bond steps to his other side and takes the bottle from hi

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: In the meantime, I'll take care of this filthy stuff.

dialogues.speaker: VAVRA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: [He calls to them in Romany. ] Vavra approaches speaking fondly. When he reaches them he pats Bond's shoulder.  62.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Vavra thanks you for saving his life. You are now his son.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Vavra) Oh, thank you. (to Kerim) I'd like to ask him a favour. Could he stop the girl fight? Kerim speaks to Vavra in Romany. Vavra replies with a lau pats Bond's shoulder again and exits.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (to Bond) He says your heart is too soft to be a real Gypsy. But he'll let you decide the matter.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: As if I didn't have enough problems! He raises the Rachi bottle and sniffs it.

dialogues.speaker: THE ENCAMPMENT
dialogues.text: More Gypsies now surround the Bulgars and their truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sits at a bowl washing his face then picks up a towe He hears something and looks back. DOLLY BACK TO REVEAL Z and Vida entering demurely, then Kerim follows smoking a cigarette. He leans devilishly against a tent-pole.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (to Bond) Vavra said for you to decide. So decide. They are both yours. He puts the cigarette in his mouth, turns and exits chuck

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to himself) This might take some time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ACROSS the camp as Gypsies make repairs, tend animals cook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond reclines on cushions with a coffee tray beside him a Zora and Vida kneel before him. Zora hands him a cup of coffee as Vida sews his shirtsleeve. Bond raises the cup but lowers it again so Vida can cut t thread with her teeth. DOLLY BACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The station wagon waits at the porch. Kerim is in the passenger seat and his driver behind the wheel.
