Bond emerges from the house with Vida on his arm, followe Zora, Vavra and a GUARD. Vida takes Bond's hands, then Bo turns to the car. She calls to him. The driver opens the back door.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Kerim) Did you pick up that package at the hotel?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: It's on the seat. DOLLY IN as Bond climbs into the back seat and Kerim pass the rifle back to him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you. Bond shuts the door and the car drives off. TILT UP to th porch where the Gypsies all wave goodbye and call out in Romany.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim walk round a corner. Behind them stands a story apartment house with a billboard mounted on it. The billboard contains a picture of Anita Ekberg and the words, 'HARRY SALTZMAN, ALBERT R. BROCCOLI PRESENT BOB HO AND ANITA EKBERG in CALL ME BWANA.'  64. Bond and Kerim stop at a dark alcove beside a shop and lo back.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Twice has Krilencu tried to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step further back into the alcove.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: The third time he will succeed... unless I get him first. That I'll do tonight.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Not with that arm, you won't. Bond takes the folded rifle from his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You'd better leave it to me.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I'm already too much in your debt.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S HANDS
dialogues.text: assemble the rifle.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: How can a friend be in debt?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Here. He hands Kerim an infra-red telescopic lens. through it.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Infra-red lens. Kerim looks It pans across the billboard then stops on Ekberg's mouth

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Shh!  65.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND KERIM
dialogues.text: They step back and look through some fencing. They see a clear street. They keep looking. From their POV, TWO POLICEMEN come walking down the stree beyond the fence. Bond and Kerim keep watching, Bond grip the rifle. The policemen come closer then stop. Kerim signals Bond to do nothing, then steps forward. The policemen turn away.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: My sons. They will ring his doorbell. He has a private escape hatch. Kerim hands the infra-red lens to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim lurk in f.g. as the two policemen approach apartment house in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ALCOVE
dialogues.text: Bond raises the rifle to look through it but it wobbles. Kerim steps in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Try this for size. Bond rests the barrel across Kerim's shoulder and peers through the lens.

dialogues.speaker: THE BILLBOARD, (THROUGH LENS)
dialogues.text: We PAN ACROSS the billboard to reveal two windows.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Do you notice anything?

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not yet. He keeps looking.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She has a lovely mouth, that Anita. We PAN BACK ACROSS the billboard to Anita's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yes. I see what you mean.  66.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIDE OF THE HOUSE
dialogues.text: The two policemen approach.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Arm or no arm, I have to pull that trigger.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (handing him the rifle) Here, if you think you can. You've got one shot, remember.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: It'll have to do. Kerim puts the rifle on Bond's shoulder and looks through sight.

dialogues.speaker: SIDE OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: The two policemen stand at the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOORBELL
dialogues.text: The hand of one of the policemen rings the bell.

dialogues.speaker: FRONT OF HOUSE
dialogues.text: The light in one of the windows goes out, then suddenly a trap-door opens in Anita's mouth and light streams throug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quick! He's coming! ZOOM IN to the trap door. Krilencu peers out.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - Kerim takes aim over Bond's shoulder. - Krilencu lowers a rope through the opening. - DOLLY IN on Kerim watching intently. - Krilencu climbs out the opening. - Kerim keeps watching.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Quick!  67. - Krilencu dangles from the rope. - DOLLY IN closer on Kerim. He fires the rifle. - Krilencu spins around, shot in the back. - Kerim looks up at him over Bond's shoulder. - Krilencu hangs desperately from the rope, then falls wi scream.

dialogues.speaker: THE APARTMENT HOUSE
dialogues.text: Krilencu's body tumbles to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TILT DOWN on Krilencu's falling body. It lands with a CRU

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (handing him the rifle) That pays many debts. Kerim walks off.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: She should have kept her mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: THE STREET
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim walk off around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond enters the darkened room, turns on the lights and lo around. He walks to a table where his briefcase rests, se his folded rifle on it and tosses down his key. DOLLY BACK as he slips off his shoes, picks up the briefc and rifle, walks to a couch and sits. A set of French doo behind him is open, revealing a balcony, but he doesn't notice. He sets down the briefcase, opens it, places the rifle in and closes it. Then he rises, removes his jacket and hols and picks up a telephone.  68.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello?... Uh, breakfast for one at nine, please... Green figs, yogourt, coffee very black... Thank you. He sets down the phone, removes his tie and walks to the bathroom door, then turns and looks back. He sniffs, but ignores it and turns back to the door unbuttoning his shi

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BATHROOM
dialogues.text: The door opens. Bond enters removing his shirt and turns the lights. The tosses his shirt aside and turns the tap the bathtub. Steaming water comes out. He removes his socks, then DOLLY IN as he removes his pan Suddenly he hears a soft noise. He glances around then finishes removing his pants. He hears a louder noise. He pulls a towel around his waist and leaves the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LOUNGE
dialogues.text: Bond comes out of the bathroom. He picks up his gun and g out onto the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: We see it through curtains on a set of French doors. A na Tania runs past and climbs into the bed.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Bond enters through the French doors. He looks ahead. Tania, in bed, whips a blanket around her. PAN ON BOND as he walks toward her aiming his gun.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: You look surprised. I thought you were expecting me.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, so you're Tatiana Romanova.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: My friends call me Tania.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Mine call me James Bond. He places the gun in his other hand and shakes her hand.  69.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, now that we've been properly introduced... Bond moves toward her holding the gun. She pushes it away

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Careful. Guns upset me. He sits on the edge of the bed and sets the revolver on t nightstand.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I'ma bit, eh... upset myself.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: You like just like your... your photograph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look even better than yours. Much... much better.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: If you are looking for concealed weapons... She touches a black band around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I take it this is your traveling outfit?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't think this kulturny?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I'll tell you something kulturny.] You're one of the most beautiful girls I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Thank you, but I think my mouth is too big.  70.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No, it's the right size...

dialogues.speaker: EXTREME C.U.
dialogues.text: Her lips part invitingly.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: for me, that is. He leans forward and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes. (he kisses her again) Is it here?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (brushes his lips against hers) The decoding machine —- the Lektor.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (kissing him) Must we talk about it now?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Or is it at the Russian Consulate? They kiss again, lingering.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Umm... yes.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes. (he leans back) I would need a plan of the place. If you could get one, we can meet at the Saint Sofia Mosque, like we were tourists.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (leaning forward) Why don't you ask me that... later?  71. She embraces him, then runs a finger down his back until touches the scar.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Now what are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: The scar. You see, I know all about you... from your file.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Mmm, do you? Well, I hope you're not, uh... disappointed. She leans back onto the pillow seductively.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I will tell you in the morning. Bond embraces her and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: THE BED
dialogues.text: revealing a mirror behind it as Bond and Tania kiss. PAN to the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND TANIA
dialogues.text: We see them now through the other side of a one-way mirro PULL BACK TO REVEAL Kleb and a MAN in a storeroom; he is filming Bond and Tania in bed. He nods to Kleb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A wide shot looking at the Aya Sofia Mosque over the Bospherous.

dialogues.speaker: GALATA BRIDGE
dialogues.text: Tania approaches the bridge and walks up some steps. Hass enters in f.g. and watches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON Tania as she walks past the mosque, then HOLD. Has peers around the corner of the building at her.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: A GUIDE leads a TOUR GROUP through the mosque.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: We are now approaching the most interesting corner of Saint Sofia... including these two great red porphyry columns stolen and brought from Egypt. Tania enters through a side door. Bond enters behind the sightseers. He wears sunglasses and carries a bag. As the walk away he turns to one side.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: In front of them, alabaster urn was brought from Bergama, a famous historical city near Smyrna. It dates back from the Alexander the Great period. Bond stops beside a towering column. Hesitantly, Tania walks closer. She stops and pulls her h back from her eyes and looks at him. Bond takes off his sunglasses and looks back. Tania looks back. Bond gestures with the sunglasses for Tania to move off.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: About sixteen forty-eight, Sultan Murad the Fourth brought it from Bergama. It was used as an ablution fountain. It contains a thousand litres of water. Right after the ablution fountain we are going to a highly interesting column over there... Tania moves off and Bond does the same. We CONTINUE WITH BOND as he passes more columns then reac the base of a huge pillar-complex. Right ahead he sees Hassan, looking around the far end of the complex. Bond d forward to conceal himself against it.

dialogues.speaker: GUIDE
dialogues.text: known for centuries as Saint Sofia wishing column. Tens of thousands of people have wished here, putting their right hand and middle finger in the hole.  73.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: approaches the pillar-complex as Hassan watches from f.g.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: runs to the other side of the complex to intercept Tania doesn't see her.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: stops at pillar on the side of the complex near Hassan an opens her handbag.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: sets his bag down behind a pillar and runs forward pullin his revolver. He wraps a handkerchief around it. Then he returns to the base of the complex and peers around at Ha who still stands looking around the corner ahead.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Her hand sets down a compact at the base of the pillar. T UP as she walks away.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE PILLAR-COMPLEX
dialogues.text: Hassan, looking around the corner, watches her go. Bond, behind the next corner, watches Hassan. Bond steps to see Tania go then steps forward again. Hassan heads for the pillar where Tania left the compact. Bond looks back, looks in Hassan's direction, looks back again.

dialogues.speaker: HASSAN
dialogues.text: His hand starts to pick up the compact at the base of the pillar. Suddenly ANOTHER MAN enters. His foot smashes down onto t hand holding the compact and he bashes Hassan's neck with Karate chops. Hassan drops to the floor dead, the compact his hand.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: looks in Hassan's direction then steps around the corner heads for the spot where Hassan had stood.  74.

dialogues.speaker: HASSAN'S BODY
dialogues.text: His attacker starts to walk away then turns back, pulling a pair of gloves. It's Grant. He looks ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: walks along the pillar-complex toward the corner.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: walks quietly away.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN as he arrives at Hassan's body. Bond reaches down and takes the compact from his hand. He looks inside and sees a piece of paper. He removes and op the paper. It is a small, hand-drawn map.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER MAP
dialogues.text: a large blueprint of the same area. It lowers revealing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK as Kerim sets the blueprint on his desk. Bond s on the edge of the desk holding the compact.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I promise you it wasn't one of my men who killed him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, he didn't die of old age. All I know is that it saved me a job. (removes the hand- drawn map) Once he'd seen the girl, she was obviously compromised and so...

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (indicating the compact) And he wasn't killed because of that!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Let's just say that Istanbul's a rough town.  75. DOLLY IN as Bond sets down the compact, approaches Kerim unfolds the hand-drawn map.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Now, let's see how Tania's map of the Russian Consulate compares with your architect's plans.

dialogues.speaker: THE DRAWINGS
dialogues.text: Bond's finger points between the two maps.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: This is the Conference Room in the Russian Consulate. Yeah, that checks. And this is the Communication Room. That's the same. TILT UP to TWO-SHOT of Bond and Kerim.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Now, she says she works there with the Lektor every day between two and three.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: How is she going to get the machine over to us?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, she's leaving that to me. She'll do anything I say. Kerim laughs. DOLLY BACK as he picks up the architect's drawing and sits on the edge of his desk in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Anything? My dear James, you are not using this. (taps his head) It all sounds too easy to me. (starts folding the drawing) We don't even know if she's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I intend to find out.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Where? In the hotel?  76.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No, she won't go there again. Says it's too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: The old game! Give a wolf a taste then keep him hungry. My friend, she's got you dangling.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: That doesn't matter. All I want is that Lektor.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: All? (looks back at Bond) Are you sure that's all you want?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well... They both grin, then Kerim laughs then Bond laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ferry boat passes by in the crowded harbor and toots it whistle.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FERRY BOAT
dialogues.text: Bond walks upstairs onto a deck then along the deck. He w a hat and sunglasses and carries a camera. He stops, lean back against a railing and removes his sunglasses. Tania rounds a corner of the deck ahead of him. She wears sunglasses, a scarf and long coat. Bond looks at her. She looks back. He approaches her but stops short, turning to the railing and opening his camer case. Tania walks up beside him.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: Bond winds the camera.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Lovely view.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: James, we must leave here now. If that agent reports my seeing you...  77.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Don't worry. He won't.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: But you don't understand —- it's a danger. Bond looks at her unconcerned. He steps back and aims the camera at her.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: James, look...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Smile! He presses a button, then gestures to her to move back as MAN walks past them.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Another one. Further back. DOLLY IN as they move to a corner of the deck and the man walks off.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: About the machine...

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: That's all you're interested in. Not me.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Business first.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I know. Once you have got what you want...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I haven't got it yet. But if you tell me about the machine, well... afterwards we won't always be working on the company's time. TANIA. All right. What do you want to know? Bond glances around then lowers the front flap of the cam case, revealing a tape recorder.  78.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Talk into this. Answer my questions quietly but clearly.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: How long is the machine?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Like... like a typewriter.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Weight?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: About ten kilos. In a brown case. Brown like your eyes.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Keep it technical. Self- calibrating or manual?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Both. With an in-built compensator. James, couldn't we...?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Not now. Talk into the camera. How many keys?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Symbol or code keys?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Both.

dialogues.speaker: A LARGER TAPE RECORDER
dialogues.text: The reels are spinning. PULL BACK to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tape recorder is on 'M's' desk and he sits listening. Moneypenny sits beside him taking notes. Across the desk a NAVAL OFFICER, an ARMY OFFICER and FOUR OTHER SUPERNUMERARIES. 'M' lights and puffs his pipe. Bond and Tania's voices come through the speakers:  79.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: There are twenty-four symbols, sixteen code keys. It is inserted ina slot. And the message comes out on a paper roll from another slot on the other side. And the mechanism is... oh, James... James... will you make love to me all the time in England?

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Day and night. Go on about the mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Oh, yes, the mechanism. Once when it was being repaired I saw the inside. There were many perforated discs made, I think, of copper, with a small light...

dialogues.speaker: TANIA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Dooshka, tell me the truth. Am TI as exciting as all those Western girls? Miss Moneypenny blinks, then breaks into a cryptic grin.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Oh, once when I was with 'M' in Tokyo, we had an interesting experience. 'M' shuts off the machine. tM! Thank you, Miss Moneypenny. That's all, that's all. She gets up and exits past the men. We hear a door close, then 'M' re-starts the tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Later, later.

dialogues.speaker: IN MISS MONEYPENNY'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Miss Moneypenny flips on her intercom and sits down at he desk. She hears the tape playing in the other room.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Those copper discs, are they light?  80.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Of course. Light, light. James, come closer. I want to whisper something.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S VOICE
dialogues.text: Go on with what you were telling me... No, not that! The mechanism!

dialogues.speaker: "M'S VOICE, (OVER INTERCOM)
dialogues.text: Miss Moneypenny, as you're no doubt listening, perhaps you'd take this cable. Text reads... merchandise appears genuine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond sits across from Kerim's desk reading the telegram a

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (overlapping 'M') ',.. merchandise appears genuine. Stop. Go ahead with deal. Signed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim walks up to Bond, a cigarette in a yellow holder in mouth. Kerim takes the telegram, sits on the edge of his and reads.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Kerim) Now all I have to do is to tell the girl the date.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: The thirteenth?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: The fourteenth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taxi pulls up to the curb. Bond hands the driver some m and gets out. TRUCK WITH HIM as he walks to the embassy g A PORTER opens the gate for him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Visa? The porter opens the gate and gestures to Bond to enter. passes into the compound.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond steps up to a DOORMAN.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Visas?

dialogues.speaker: DOORMAN
dialogues.text: (pointing; in Russian) There.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you. PAN ON BOND as he walks into a large reception room. He s at a desk where a CLERK faces a MAN. There is a large clo on the wall in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Take and fill in this form, write your surname and bring it back to me in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Yes, thank you. The man walks away.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to clerk) Visa, please. The clerk hands him a form.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Your clock. (glances at it) Is it correct?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Of course. Bond walks to a bench at the wall. The clerk calls out "Agregarium!" A SECOND MAN rises from the bench and walks off. Bond looks at his watch.  82.

dialogues.speaker: BOND'S WATCH
dialogues.text: It shows 3:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim sits on a box looking at his watch. A detonator res at his feet. In b.g., rats scurry about through a break i the cavern wall.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RECEPTION ROOM
dialogues.text: Bond walks back to the clerk, who is still talking to the second man.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Excuse me. You did say your cock was correct?

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: Russian clocks are always —- A sudden explosion smashes through the floor behind Bond. clock falls from the wall. Debris cascades down from the ceiling. Bond rises with a big grin. He says something to himself turns to an archway behind him. Embassy men run frantically around as Bond exits through archway. The clerk starts grabbing drawers from his desk. Other EMPLOYEES run behind him with drawers and files.

dialogues.speaker: IN A HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Smoke fills it. Bond runs down the hall carrying a gas ma TRUCK WITH HIM as he passes through a swinging door into another hall and puts on the mask. He continues into the conference room then turns to an iron gate. At the same t a LADY emerges through the gateway carrying files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond lunges toward the gateway. A GUARD holding a gun tri to close the gate. Bond grabs his arm and makes the gun f wide.  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tania looks up from her desk, which she had been wiping w cloth. The Lektor sits on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND THE GUARD
dialogues.text: Bond wrestles the guard to the floor and knocks him out w judo-chop to the neck.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE COMMUNICATIONS ROOM
dialogues.text: DOLLY IN as Bond runs in. He sees the machine.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Is this the Lektor?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (unplugs it and hands him the cord) Yes! Tania starts to cough. Bond hands her the gas mask.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Here, take this. It's only tear gas.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I thought it was for tomorrow, as today is the thirteenth, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: This is a hell of a time to be superstitious. (he shuts the case and grabs the Lektor) Come on! He runs through the gateway; Tania follows holding the ga mask.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: A few flames burn. Bond and Tania run inside.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Come on, quickly! DOLLY WITH THEM as he leads her across the room to a hole the floor. He climbs into the hole, Tania following.  84.

dialogues.speaker: SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Smoke pours out as men run from the Consulate carrying documents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fire truck pulls up as a crowd watches.

dialogues.speaker: THE CONSULATE
dialogues.text: Firemen run toward the building with hoses.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE UNDERGROUND CISTERN
dialogues.text: Kerim helps Bond and Tania down some steps from a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Tania) Keep your head down. DOLLY BACK as they walk under an archway into a second ca Suddenly they see a flood of rats running at them. Tania screams.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Back inside! He and Tania turn back. The rats keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FIRST CAVERN
dialogues.text: Kerim watches as Bond and Tania enter under the archway.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: This way! Quickly! They run off. The rate keep coming.

dialogues.speaker: CAVERN
dialogues.text: Kerim leads Bond and Tania through a forest of pillars. P ON THEM as they run to a stairway. They dash up two flights of steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A knock sounds from under a trap-door in the floor. A MAN opens it. Kerim comes up followed by Tania.  85.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Kerim, Tania and Bond run outside. They are across the st from the Consulate. The street is blocked by fire trucks spectators. They run across the street, avoiding traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN ON Kerim, Tania and Bond as they run across a platfor a train. Bond jumps over a newsrack to keep up with them. announcement is being broadcast in Turkish. Tania suddenly stops. Bond stops and runs back to her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (looking off) Benz, the Russian security man.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: sit at a table eating. Benz looks off at Tania and rises.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND TANIA
dialogues.text: He takes her arm.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Come on, never mind!

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Kerim stands on the steps with a PORTER on the platform b him.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (calling back to Bond) Hurry! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Bond and Tania jump aboard and the train starts to move. and the other man look on in f.g.

dialogues.speaker: BENZ
dialogues.text: He suddenly jumps up, grabbing a briefcase and hat.  86.

dialogues.speaker: BENZ
dialogues.text: (to the other man; in Russian) Telephone the Consulate!

dialogues.speaker: OTHER MAN
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Yes... yes...

dialogues.speaker: BENZ
dialogues.text: (in Russian) Dear Corporal Romanova has defected to the English! He runs to the passing train and jumps aboard. Grant watches him through a window of one of the compartm ZOOM IN on Grant as he closes the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kerim leads Tania and Bond down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Here's one of them... and there's the other one. Kerim steps into the first compartment as Bond and Tania to the other.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE FIRST COMPARTMENT, (TANIA'S)
dialogues.text: Kerim opens a connecting door to the other compartment, revealing Bond and Tania. Kerim hands Bond two passports.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Your passports. The pictures do not do you justice. I have rarely seen a handsomer couple. Bond looks at them. Tania looks over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (reading) Mister and Misses David Somerset. (to Tania) Your name's Caroline. He hands her a passport.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Caroline. I like that name.  87.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You're accompanying me on a business trip. On the way back to Derbyshire.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: To our children?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No children. DOLLY BACK as Bond and Kerim turn to the door to the corr

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Not even one little boy?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (turning back) Nyet.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I like big families myself. In fact, my whole life has been a crusade for larger families.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: So I've heard. Kerim turns down the corridor. Bond stops in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Tania?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Keep the door locked. I'11 knock three times.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Okay. He shuts the door and she locks it.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Bond looks out the window. Kerim takes out his yellow cigarette holder and his cigarette case.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I'll go see the conductor now.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You sure he'll cooperate?  88.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Oh, we've done business before. He'll stop the train near the Bulgarian frontier where my sons will be waiting with a car. We'll be there... about six o'clock. A WOMAN IN A SCARF turns into the corridor and walks towa them.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And the airstrip?

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Twenty miles. Bond and Kerim pause and back up. She walks between them down the corridor then enters a compartment.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: The plane is chartered to Athens. You'll be in London tomorrow. Kerim places a cigarette in the holder and turns down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: We'll drink to that in London. He knocks three times on the compartment door.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: She opens it to admit Bond. He enters closes it behind hi She wraps her arms around him.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: So, we are really on our way to England!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes, with a lovely two-day honeymoon before us.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Honeymoon? And I have nothing to wear.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Ah! He holds up her black ribbon and puts it around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Your trousseau!  89.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (holding the ribbon) Oh, James!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (holding up a finger) Ah, one moment. He backs away raising his jacket cuffs then holds up his as if to say there's nothing there, then he disappears be the door to the other compartment. Tania looks on in puzzlement. Suddenly the door is kicked open revealing Bond holding u blue negligee.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Oh, no! James, James! (she hugs him, then glances down surprised) Oh, look! Look! She kneels in amazement to a suitcase and looks through t clothes in it. She rises holding another blue negligee. She swings aroun then holds it up against herself. Bond takes the black ri from her hand and holds it against her neck.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: There. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN on it as it barrels past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tania wears a blue negligee and dances around humming "Th Blue Danube." Bond sits on the couch reading a newspaper. She drops down and lies across him. He wraps an arm aroun her neck.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Oh, I will wear this one... in Piccadilly.  90.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You won't. They've just passed some new laws there.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Benz stands at door to Tania's compartment, listening, th moves on. Kerim rounds the corner behind him and watches. Benz pauses the next compartment door, listens and moves Kerim watches closely, then knocks on Tania's door.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Through the doorway to Bond's compartment we see her feet she lies with him in bed.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You're nearest.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Oh, all right. Tania gets up and walks into her compartment. She is weae her negligee and has her hair tied up in a bun. She opens door. Kerim enters and looks at her approvingly.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Charming! Charming! Kerim turns to the doorway to Bond's compartment. Bond emerges tying his tie.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Let's go to the restaurant car, James, for... that drink.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Surely.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: (off to Tania) Charming! Kerim exits past Tania. Bond follows putting his coat on.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Tania) We'll continue the fashion show later. He goes out into the corridor and she shuts the door and it.  91.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Bond and Kerim look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Everything is arranged for me to stop the train. We'll get off from the restaurant car... (he nods down the hall) It's up that end.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Fine, we'll meet you there at six o'clock then.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Make it just a little later. But there are slight complications. (he turns and looks up the hall) One of the Russian security men, Benz —- he watches the airports and the stations —- he's on the train.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: But he couldn't have had time to contact the Consulate before he boarded.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Well, just in case, I'll keep him company for the next two hours until it's time to get off. PAN on Kerim as he starts down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Perhaps you'd like me to introduce you?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (approaching him) Charming! They walk together down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: IN BENZ' COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Benz stands looking out the window. He hears a knock at t door and turns.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Ticket control.  92. Benz walks to the door taking some money from his pocket. opens the door then freezes. Kerim's hand aims a gun at h stomach. Benz backs away, drops onto the couch and drops as Kerim follows. Bond shuts the door. PAN OVER to Kerim. He pulls Benz' handkerchief from his pocket and stuffs it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Do not be alarmed, my friend. We will make you as comfortable as possible. Bond and Kerim pull Benz to his feet. Kerim takes a gun f inside his jacket then Bond pulls the jacket down over hi arms.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Now I'm sure Commissar Benz will have a much safer journey. Bond pivots Benz forward.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'm not mad about his tailor. Are you? Bond shoves him and he drops back onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: You know, James, life in Istanbul will never be the same without you.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll see you in the restaurant car. Bond walks off. TILT DOWN with Kerim as he sits beside Be and starts to raise his yellow cigarette holder.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: I've had a particularly fascinating life. Would you like to hear about it? Benz grunts.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: You would?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Bond walks away through a doorway into the next train car Grant emerges from behind the doorway, wearing his gloves glances back at Bond then walks forward.  93.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: She lies on the couch wearing a blue nightdress and looki her face in a mirror. She holds a lock of hair under her like a mustache. She hears a triple-knock at the door, jumps up and opens Bond enters looking at her and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Do you like it? She walks toward the couch. Bond follows.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes. It does rather suit you.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I will save everything else for England.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Uh, it is four o'clock, you know.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: It is not kulturny in the afternoon? (Bond looks at her) Even on a honeymoon? (Bond keeps looking) Than I will take it off. She steps forward out of frame removing a strap as Bond watches.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I think we are talking at cross- purposes again. [A couple of hours will straighten that out. Bond pulls down the blind. ]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW the spinning wheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT of the wall, then TILT DOWN to reveal Bond and Tania lying on the couch. She smokes a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tania...

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Um-mm?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: We'd better get dressed now.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: It's almost six.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, it's, uh... it's tea time.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: We'll have it in here. We'll have all our meals here.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yeah, that would be splendid. But I've arranged to meet Kerim in the restaurant car.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Mmm, you go alone. I will stay here. Bond takes her cigarette, rises and walks to is covered with the blind.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: My dear Mrs. Somerset, we're supposed to be a respectable English couple. (he pulls on the blind) We would certainly have tea in the restaurant car —- 94. the window which The blind rolls up with a loud snap that startles Bond. T walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Now, listen... (kisses her) Just do as I say, will you?  95.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Yes, James. He picks up his tie and passes her, smacking her bottom.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: But there are some English customs...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looking back) Hmm?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: that are going to be changed.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (wrapping his tie around her finger) But of course, darling. She holds the tie between her teeth and starts laughing. grins.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: PAN on it as it rushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen through the open doorway of Tania's compartment, Bon Tania are dressed. She wears her long jacket and buttons Bond wears his shoulder holster and puts on his coat.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Do I look nice, Mister Somerset?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes. —- Uh... He faces her and puts a ring on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Misses Somerset.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (in Russian) How pretty!  96. Bond opens the compartment door, picks up the Lektor and step into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Tania holds up and admires the ring as Bond shuts the doo They turn down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CONDUCTOR suddenly runs down the corridor calling urgen

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: Mister Somerset! Mister Somerset!

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND TANIA
dialogues.text: turn back. The conductor approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: (anxiously) You are the friend of Kerim Bey?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: There has been a terrible accident. Please come quickly. The conductor turns back down the corridor. Bond opens th door and pushes Tania back into her compartment, handing the Lektor.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: No tea?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Later. Keep the door locked. He shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond follows the conductor down the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CORRIDOR OF THE NEXT CAR
dialogues.text: The conductor leads Bond to the door to Benz' compartment MAN walks past them. The conductor looks both ways then starts to open the door.  97.

dialogues.speaker: IN BENZ' COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: The door slides open the rest of the way revealing Bond a the conductor.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: They killed each other! DOLLY BACK as Bond walks in, to reveal Kerim and Benz lyi dead. Kerim lies face-down on the floor with a knife in h back. Benz lies on the couch with a bullet-hole in his ch Near Kerim's face is his yellow cigarette holder. Bond kneels and lays his hand on Kerim's shoulder, survey the scene, then rises.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to the conductor) This must be kept quiet until we reach Trieste.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: It will be difficult.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (reaching into his jacket, with disdain) I'm sure. (Bond takes out some cash and counts it) Kerim Bey was a very influential man. He had many influential friends. I'm sure they also will reward you. He gives some money to the conductor and puts the rest aw

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR
dialogues.text: I'll try. Bond frowns with disdain again, then looks down at Kerim.

dialogues.speaker: KERIM
dialogues.text: Bond's hand reaches down and squeezes his shoulder. Then picks up the cigarette holder.

dialogues.speaker: TWO-SHOT
dialogues.text: Bond rises and, with a last look back, turns into the cor followed by the conductor, who closes the door behind the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train races forward. Kerim's chauffeur stands in fron the station wagon on a cross-road watching. PAN on the tr as it passes him.

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAUFFEUR
dialogues.text: with his hands on his hips watches in puzzlement. From his POV, the train keeps passing by. The chauffeur keeps watching. From his POV, the train now travels into the distance. The chauffeur looks at his watch then runs back to the st wagon. ANOTHER MAN sits at the wheel. The chauffeur calls him in Turkish (we hear the word "telefona") then jumps i the passenger seat and the car drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the couch folding a sweater. A triple-knock sounds at the door. She gets up and unlocks it. From outside, Bond slams the door open and glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: What is it? She looks at him, not comprehending.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Kerim's dead!

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Dead?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Um-umm. Tania backs up and sits on the couch, shocked. Bond approaches.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Now, I want the truth! He reaches down, grabs her wrists and yanks her to her fe DOLLY IN closer.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: James, you're hurting me!  99.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll do worse than that if you don't tell me! You're doing this under orders, I know. What are they?

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I don't know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Liar! He slaps her face and she flies back, landing on the couc Bond goes

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (holding her cheek) Even if you kill me I can say nothing. I did not know anything like Kerim's death would happen. But when we get to England, I tell you. to her.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: (falling back crying) Oh, no!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (sitting beside her) Tania, maybe they didn't let you in on all of this, but whatever you do know, tell me. He grabs her arms from behind. She responds by stroking h hand.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I know I love you, James. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I love you, I love you, it's true.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Sure.  100. He rises, takes the Lektor from an overhead luggage rack, into his compartment and shuts the door. We hear Tania crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train races forward. PAN on it as it goes by. FADE IN SUPERIMPOSITION of a map of Europe and PAN across it, sho the train's route, from 'Sofiya' to 'Beograd.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train approaches the station. The SUPERIMPOSITION FAD OUT.

dialogues.speaker: GUARD, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling) Belgrade! Belgrade!

dialogues.speaker: AT A RAILING
dialogues.text: Kerim's son MAHMET, wearing a suit and tie and holding hi hat, watches.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: comes to a stop at the platform. Bond immediately alights reaching inside his coat.

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: sees him and follows.

dialogues.speaker: ALONG THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Bond walks past the train putting a cigarette in his mout Through the windows behind him we see Grant inside follow him. Bond stops and looks back. Grant disappears behind a partition. Bond walks forward again. Grant again follows. Nearing the end of the train, Bond stops and looks around people walking by

dialogues.speaker: ALONG THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Mahmet, holding a cigarette, hurries to Bond.

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: Excuse me.  101. Bond turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: May I borrow a match?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (lighting his cigarette) I use a lighter.

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: Better still.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Until they go wrong. Bond gestures feebly, slips the lighter into his pocket a starts walking with Mahmet; TRUCK with them.

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: My brother telephoned me. Why did the train not stop?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I... I have some... some bad news. Bond stops and gives Mahmet a direct look.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Your father's dead.

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: Who did it? Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, he took care of that himself. The other man died first. (all business) Now, listen. Bond tosses his cigarette aside. DOLLY IN closer.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll need some help to get across the frontier strip between Yugoslavia and Trieste. I want you to send a message to 'M' in London. Tell him to send someone from Station Y to meet me in Zagreb. All right?

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: I will.  102.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Good. Bond nods to him, then PAN on Bond as he walks away. Then stops and turns back.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh. DOLLY BACK as Bond returns to Mahmet taking out Kerim's w and cigarette holder.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (handing them to Mahmet ) You'll, uh —- I think you'll want these.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (calling to Bond in French) Monsieur Somerset, the train is leaving!

dialogues.speaker: MAHMET
dialogues.text: (to Bond) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (backing away) Ciao.

dialogues.speaker: CONDUCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (in English) The train is leaving! Bond turns and walks off. Mahmet turns the other way and looks at the objects in his hands. DOLLY BACK as he walks away. Then HOLD on the train. We see Grant looking out through a window in a door of the caboose. The train starts moving. Grant turns into the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN on the wheels as they gather speed.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Passenger windows fly by, many with people looking outsid

dialogues.speaker: THE JOURNEY
dialogues.text: PAN on the wheels as the train speeds along. Then DISSOLV a wider angle of the train continuing into the distance. DISSOLVE TO a deserted station as the train races by. The DISSOLVE TO the speeding wheels again. Meanwhile FADE IN a SUPERIMPOSITION of the map of Europe. across it showing the route from Belgrade to Zagreb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train pulls into the station. FADE OUT the SUPERIMPOSITION. The train sounds its whistle. DISSOLVE T shot of the passenger windows passing by.

dialogues.speaker: THE STATION
dialogues.text: seen through a window in a door. A sign comes into view: "ZAGREB.' Grant steps to the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Grant steps onto the platform, looks around and walks o - Bond walks along an inside corridor glancing out the windows. - A man in a business suit holding a briefcase stands in station waiting. He is NASH.

dialogues.speaker: ALONG THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Grant puts a cigarette in his mouth and walks purposefull through the station past many people. He reaches Nash. We see them speak and gesture but we don hear them. They start walking forward. Grant tosses his cigarette as pulls a pair of gloves from his pocket and puts them on. They turn to the restroom. Grant pats Nash on the back an Nash goes in first. Grant looks around then follows.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Bond steps onto the platform, looks around and starts wal

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE RESTROOM
dialogues.text: Grant emerges carrying the briefcase and donning Nash's h He pulls off the gloves and walks off.  104.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Bond walks forward looking around. Grant passes him. Bond looks down at Grant's briefcase. Grant backs away a bit t stops and looks at Bond. He walks up taking a cigarette c from his pocket. A gush of steam from the train drowns them out so we only them speak and gesture. At the end of their conversation, a whistle sounds. Bond gestures to hurry. Grant boards the train and Bond follow The conductor closes the door and the train starts moving

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond and Grant face each other. A conductor guides some passengers in b.g.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (offering a handshake) Nash. Captain Nash. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Bond, traveling as Somerset. Grant hands him a card.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: My card. Bond looks at it —- a touch of concern crossing his face then slips it into his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What kept you?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm so sorry. I only got 'M's wire an hour ago. I busted every record getting here.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What were 'M's orders?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Only to, uh, contact you and the lady on the train.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Good. Come this way.  105. Bond leads him to another car, then waits to let him go f

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Thank you. Bond follows him down the next corridor.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: She opens the door to a triple knock. Bond immediately enters followed by Grant.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: This is my wife Caroline. Captain Nash.

dialogues.speaker: NASH
dialogues.text: (taking off his hat) Oh, uh, how do you do. (shakes her hand) I'm so pleased to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: This way, Nash. Bond opens the door to his compartment and they go in.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Sit down, will you?

dialogues.speaker: NASH
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Bond closes the door. Grant drops Nash's briefcase and ha onto the couch, sits, crosses his legs and sighs. Bond le back against the doorjamb.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Been long in Yugoslavia?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: About three years.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Interesting work?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Yes, sometimes. Well, you know how it is, old man.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You look very fit, Nash.  106.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Yes, I try to keep in shape. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: So what's our problem, sir?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, I can't risk taking this... (points to the Lektor on the luggage rack) through the customs at the Yugoslav-Trieste border.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: No stops till then. We'll have to jump off.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (nods) Can you get us across?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Any of the opposition around?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, not in any condition to worry about.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Good. We'll make it. I know this territory like the back of my hand. He glances down at the back of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond watches him.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (leaning forward) Uh, sir, do you mind if we have a bite to eat first? I've been on the go since breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: No, of course not. Leave your things there. We'll go to the restaurant car. Bond opens the connecting door.  107.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Caroline, you go on with Captain Nash to the restaurant car.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: She rises and takes her coat as Grant walks in past Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll join you there in a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (patting his shoulder) Whatever you say, old man. (passing Tania) Excuse me. He opens the door for her and steps into the corridor. Sh follows. Grant look back at Bond with a half-smile then closes the door. Bond walks over and locks the door then goes back into hi compartment.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Grant's hat and briefcase rest on the couch. Bond sits be them and lifts the briefcase. He turns the latches sidewa and pops it open. Inside are a man's shirt and a tie. He reaches beneath th and sees a revolver. He picks it up, feeling its heft, th puts it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant sits with Tania at a table waiting. He looks back a the entrance then at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Excuse me. He gets up and steps toward the entrance. Just then Bond enters carrying the Lektor.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Ah, there are you, old man. I was worried something had happened to you. They walk back to the table. Bond sits beside Tania, Gran across from them.  108.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND TANIA
dialogues.text: A WAITER walks up to their table.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Pardon, monsieur. He hands Bond a menu.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Thank you. He hands a menu to Grant, off.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thank you. Bond looks at the menu.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll have the grilled sole. He looks at Tania for approval. She shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And for madam. (to Grant, off) What about you, Nash?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Yes. That sounds very nice. Make that three of those, will you?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll have a bottle of the Blanc de Blanc.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Make mine Chianti.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: White Chianti, monsieur?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Uh, no. The red kind. Bond, unfolding his napkin, glances up at Grant. The wait walks away.  109.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Well, enjoy your dinner, old man. I think I've got the answer to our problems. Very simple, really.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train races by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond, Tania and Grant are eating dinner. In front of Bond Tania are glasses of white wine and a wine bottle. In fro of Grant is a glass of red wine, the bottle nearby.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (glancing at his watch) We should reach the border in about an hour.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT'S HAND
dialogues.text: reaches for the salt but knocks over Tania's wine glass.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm terribly sorry, Misses Somerset. Most clumsy of me. Grant dabs the spot with his napkin.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (calling) Waiter?!

dialogues.speaker: WAITER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oui, monsieur? Grant picks up the wine bottle and Tania's glass, then gl sharply back.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Waiter?!

dialogues.speaker: WAITER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tout suite, monsieur!  110.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT'S HAND
dialogues.text: refills the glass and at the same time drops a white pill it.

dialogues.speaker: OVER GRANT'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: Bond eats as Grant sets down the wine bottle and glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waiter picks up something.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Merci. He walks away.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: You'll, uh... you'll find Trieste quite interesting. Of course, it's not London. Grant lets out a little laugh and picks up his glass.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Cheerio! Bond raises his glass.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Cheerio. They toast each other, Grant letting out another little l and they drink.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: absently picks up her glass, looks off at Bond then sips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bond walks down the corridor carrying the Lektor, opens t [unlocked] door to Tania's compartment and goes it. She follows, tipping from one wall to the other.

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: I don't feel very well. My head! Grant holds her from behind. Bond looks out from the compartment.  111.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: The lady's come over faint.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Bring her in here.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: May 1? He guides Tania to the doorway. Bond backs up and Grant w her inside.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Bond takes her and lies her down on the couch. She moans.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (to Grant) Let's go next door. He opens the door to his compartment.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (looking at Tania) Exhaustion, I'd say.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Hmm . Grant steps into Bond's compartment. Bond turns off the l in Tania's compartment then follows Grant, closing the do behind him.

dialogues.speaker: IN BOND'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Bond locks the door and turns his back on Grant.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What was it —- the stuff you put in her drink?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Chloral-hydrate. Quick but mild. Bond takes out his pistol and turns, aiming it at Grant.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (raising his arms) Take it easy, 0-0-seven. Bond glares at him.  112.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: My escape route's only for one. (smiles slightly) What are you after, the girl or the Lektor?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (relenting, stops aiming at Grant) All right. What is your plan?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Explain it better on a map. (gestures with one hand to his pocket) All right? Grant takes a map from his pocket, sits on the couch and the map on Nash's briefcase. Bond puts his pistol in his pocket and looks down. Grant points to the map with both index fingers.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Now, we're here, you see? Bond crouches beside him.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: When we reach there, there's a steep gradient. The train slows down there.

dialogues.speaker: THE MAP
dialogues.text: Grant's left hand continues pointing to the map as his ri hand comes down to his leg.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We'll block the line. Make for that main road.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Pick up a car... there.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT'S RIGHT HAND
dialogues.text: goes to his ankle. He takes a pistol from a holster under pant leg.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A truck, in fact.  113.

dialogues.speaker: BOND, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That must be about...

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: twenty miles from here. Grant suddenly slams the butt of his pistol against the b of Bond's skull. Bond groans and drops to the floor. Grant jumps up. Bond rolls across the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND GRANT
dialogues.text: Bond lies on his side in f.g. Grant kicks his leg to see he'll react. Then Grant reaches down, rolls Bond onto his back, puts h pistol to Bond's temple, takes Bond's gun from his should holster and slips into his pocket. He feels Bond's legs f more weapons, then takes his cigarette case.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Grant opens the cigarette case, sees only cigarettes, and slips it into his pocket. He takes cash from Bond's insid pocket. Bond starts to raise his hand. Grant slaps it dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grant pockets the money, then takes Bond's silencer from another pocket and rises aiming his gun at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: BOND AND GRANT
dialogues.text: Struggling, Bond sits up.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Keep still! Bond looks back.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: All right, get up on your knees. Bond rises to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Put your hands in your pockets. Keep ‘em there. Grant sits on the couch, still aiming his gun at Bond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kneeling with his hands in his pockets) Red wine with fish. That should have told me something.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: (slips the silencer into his pocket and rests his free arm on his knee) You may know the right wines, but you're the one on your knees. How does it feel, old man?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: "Old man'? Is that what you chaps in SMERSH call each other?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: (looks up with realization) Of course! SPECTRE! Then it wasn't a Russian show at all. You've been playing us off against each other, haven't you? Grant stares back at him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Then it was SPECTRE who killed the Russian agent in the mosque. You?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Um-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Kerim and the other man?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Um-hmm.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: And Nash?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Well, I don't mind talking. I get a kick out of watching the great James Bond find out what a bloody fool he's been making of himself. 114. He takes Bond's gun from his pocket, sets it on the couch then takes out the silencer.  115.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: We're pros, Mister Bond. He attaches the silencer to Bond's gun.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: We sweated your recognition code out of one of your men in Tokyo —- before he died. I've been keeping tabs on you. I've been your guardian angel. I saved your life at the Gypsy camp.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, yes. I am much obliged.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: We were keeping you alive till you could get us the Lektor.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: So you had me deliver it ona plate. It's brilliant. Go on, I'm fascinated.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Now that we've got it, you and the girl are expendable. Between here and Trieste. He picks up Bond's gun with his left hand and aims it at

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: The girl? Isn't she working for SPECTRE, too?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: No. She thinks she's doing it all for Mother Russia. She takes her orders from Colonel Kleb.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well, Rosa Kleb's Russian. Head of operations for SMERSH.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Was. Kleb works for SPECTRE now. The girl doesn't know that.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Well then, why kill her?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Orders.  116. Grant slips his own gun into his pocket then reaches into another pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: That's only half of it, old man. Bond stares at him. Grant takes out a roll of 8mm movie f

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Here's a roll of film. She'll have this in her handbag. He tosses the film onto the couch and takes an envelope f his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: And on you... they'll find this letter. It's from her. Threatening to give the film to the press unless you marry her for helping you get the Lektor. He sets the letter down.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: What film?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Taken in the bridal suite at your hotel. Something else the girl didn't know about. Or you. (he snickers) [What a performance! ]

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Must be a pretty sick collection of minds to dream up a plan like that.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Can't you see the headlines? "British agent murders beautiful Russian spy, then commits suicide'?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Tell me. Which lunatic asylum did they get you out of?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Don't make it tougher on yourself. DOLLY BACK as Grant walks over to Bond and slaps his face hard.  Bond just thinking, 117.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: My orders are to kill you and deliver the Lektor. How I do it is my business. It'll be slow and painful.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: How much are they paying you?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: What's it to you?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: We'll double it.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Your word of honour? As an English gentlemen? stares at him. Grant glances down, smirks as if then looks at Bond again.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: The first one won't kill you. Nor the second. Not even the third. Not till you crawl over here and you kiss my foot!

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: How about a cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Not a chance.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: What with?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Fifty gold sovereigns.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Up there, in my case. Grant glances up at the luggage rack. Bond watches him. Grant switches the gun to his right hand and takes the briefcase with his left. Bond keeps watching.  118.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: You show me. He tosses the briefcase onto the couch. It lands on top o Nash's. Bond takes his hands from his pockets and raises case. Grant watches.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: over Grant in f.g. aiming the gun at him. Bond opens the case, removes the straps with the sovereigns and holds th out to Grant.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Here you are. What about that cigarette?

dialogues.speaker: OVER BOND'S SHOULDER AT GRANT
dialogues.text: Grant starts pulling a glove onto his left hand.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Throw 'em down there. Bond tosses the straps onto the couch.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Any more in the other case?

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Grant in f.g. continues pulling on the glove [onto his ri hand as he holds Bond's gun with his left]. Bond stares a him.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I should imagine so. It'sa standard kit. He sets Nash's case aside and turns his own case to face

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: I'll have a look.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Grant finishes pulling the glove onto his right hand. His left hand is also gloved.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Put your hands back in your pockets!  119.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: obeys and returns his hands to his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: Keep them there. He sits on the couch and turns Bond's case toward himself

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: watches.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT OVER BOND'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: He turns the first catch on the case.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: still watches.

dialogues.speaker: THE CASE
dialogues.text: Grant's hand moves to the other catch and flips it open.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: still watches. Suddenly a gushing sound occurs 0.S.

dialogues.speaker: GRANT
dialogues.text: flies backwards in a gale of smoke shooting from the case

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: - Bond lunges through the smoke at Grant and grabs the ar with the gun. - Bond shoves Grant against the wall. - Grant twists forward. - They struggle over the gun. The gun fires. - A bullet smashes the light. - Bond and Grant, bathed in blue moonlight, keep struggli the smoke. Bond grabs the gun and throws it. - The gun smashes through the window. We see the men's reflections in the glass. Bond grabs Grant by the collar twists him around.  120. - Bond tries to pull Grant's jacket down over his arms. - WIDER ANGLE: Bond pulls Grant downward then slams a kne into his face. Grant flies backwards. - IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT: Grant crashes in through the do He bounces off the couch (where Tania is sleeping) and fl forward. His head butts into Bond's stomach - IN BOND'S COMPARTMENT: Bond crashes against the wall an falls onto the couch. - IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT: Grant dives at Bond. - Bond pivots and Grant lands on the couch in front of hi Bond stands on the couch and kicks Grant in the back then the face. Grant flies backwards. - Grant lands in a corner then ducks as Bond tries to ste him. Bond's foot goes wide and his legs arch over Grant. - Bond tries to wrap his legs around Grant's neck. Grant grabs his legs and pushes upwards in a tackle. - Bond lands backwards on the couch, Grant atop him. Bond grabs his neck with both hands and they roll onto the flo - Grant pushes Bond backwards against the couch. - Bond smashes two fists into Grant's face. - Grant falls backwards. Bond grabs him by the neck with hand. - With the other, Bond punches him in the face. Grant fal backwards, landing in the doorway to Tania's compartment. - Bond lunges forward. - Grant jumps to his feet as Bond dives at him. - Both on their feet now in the doorway, Bond throws a pu at his face. Grant ducks then punches Bond in the stomach - WIDER ANGLE: Grant pulls his arm back readying another punch. - Bond slams the connecting door into his face. - Grant falls backwards onto Tania's couch. - He lunges at Bond and grabs him around the waist. Bond grabs him under the arms and slams him against the doorja  121. - CLOSER: As Grant rebounds, Bond slams him against the o doorjamb, then against the first one... - WIDER: ... then against the second one, then against th first one. Grant suddenly heaves him backwards. - Bond falls against his couch. - Bond sinks down then kicks at Grant. - Bond's foot connects with Grant's face and Grant flies backwards, landing on his back. - Bond jumps up and runs forward. - Grant jumps up and runs forward. - Bond throws a punch at Grant and misses. Grant punches in the face then repeatedly in the stomach as Bond raises hands to defend himself. - Grant's face is contorted in anger. - Bond grabs Grant around the neck. - Grant pushes Bond against the wall. Bond keeps one hand Grant's back and plants the other on his face, trying to his neck. - CLOSER: Bond's hand pushes Grant's head back. - Bond judo-chops both sides of Grant's neck then grips t bar on the overhead rack. - WIDER: Bond swings his legs forward and kicks Grant in chest. Grant falls backwards. - Grant lands on Bond's couch. Bond releases the bar and dives at him. Grant rolls aside. Bond lands face-down on couch. Grant jumps onto his back and grabs him around the neck, then swings him around so Bond is almost sitting on Grant's lap. - CLOSE ON GRANT'S HANDS: He wears the watch containing t garrote. - Bond reaches back, struggling to grab Grant's hands. Gr reaches for his watch. - CLOSE ON GRANT'S HANDS: He pulls the garrote from his watch. - Grant slings the garrote around Bond's neck. Bond clutc at it as Grant strangles him. The back of Bond's right ha is bloody. He looks down at his briefcase and reaches for  122. - Grant continues to strangle Bond. - CLOSE ON THE BRIEFCASE: Bond's hand tries to press the button to release the knife. - Grant continues strangling him. Bond glances down. - His hand still fumbles with the briefcase. - Grant continues strangling him, Bond still looking down - Bond's finger presses the button. The knife pops out th side of the case. Bond's hand grabs it and turns it upwar - Bond swings around with the knife. - Bond plunges the knife into Grant's shoulder. Grant screams. Bond grabs him by the neck and whips him around. - Bond slings the garrote around Grant's neck. - Grant falls backwards as Bond strangles him. - Grant's head dangles now from the garrote. - Bond pulls the garrote tighter. Grant gasps. Bond pulls still tighter. Grant's head slumps back and he lands on t couch dead.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: He backs away, breathing heavily. He straightens his tie buttons his coat. Then he goes to the couch, picks up var things and puts them in his pocket. He takes his hat and briefcase and starts to back away, b returns to Grant and reaches inside his coat, taking out cash.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: You won't be needing this, old man.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Bond enters, closing the connecting doors behind him and locking them. He turns to the compartment door, opens it looks outside.

dialogues.speaker: THE RAILROAD TRACKS
dialogues.text: A truck with its hood up sits on a railroad crossing bloc the tracks up ahead. The train sounds its whistle.  123.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: puts on his hat. DOLLY BACK as he shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Tania! He goes to her and grabs her shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Wake up! He pulls her up by the collar. She is barely conscious.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Wake up or I'll leave you behind! She sinks back onto the couch, groaning. He grabs her again and pulls her up into a sitting positi

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Oh, Tania, wake up or I'll leave you behind! Do you hear me?!

dialogues.speaker: TANIA
dialogues.text: Don't leave me; never leave me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the truck now in f.g. There is a bed of flowers in back. The driver —- Rhoda —- stands next to it waiving to approaching train to stop. The train slows and sounds its whistle. The train wheels grind to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: IN TANIA'S COMPARTMENT
dialogues.text: Bond lifts Tania to her feet and leans her against the wa

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Tania, this is Nash's escape route. Do you understand? We've got to get off here. He hands her a sweater from a coat-hook.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Take this. Come on. He picks up his briefcase and the Lektor and leads her ou into the corridor.  124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO PORTERS run toward the truck calling out in Turkish. Rhoda gets behind the wheel as one of them goes to the passenger door. They move to push the car off the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: DOORWAY
dialogues.text: Bond leads Tania down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: BOND
dialogues.text: Must get to the other side of the train. Under here. He pushes her down and follows.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CROSSING
dialogues.text: The porters push the car off the tracks.

dialogues.speaker: THE SIDE OF THE TRAIN
dialogues.text: Bond and Tania emerge from underneath it, run behind some trees and duck.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CROSSING
dialogues.text: - The train starts slowly forward as the porters run back it. - Bond watches from behind a tree. - The train wheels pick up speed. - Bond darts forward and jumps onto the train. He looks around. - The train reaches the crossing. Bond jumps off and couc The rest of the train passes by. Bond runs across the tra to the passenger side of the truck as Rhoda walks back al the driver's side. - Rhoda peers down the track. - Bond crouches, watching him. - Rhoda lets out a sharp whistle.

dialogues.speaker: RHODA
dialogues.text: Grant! Where are you? - Bond keeps watching. - Rhoda walks back along the driver's side of the truck.  125.

dialogues.speaker: RHODA
